loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 31 years old, married and has two children. He operates a cereal shop for a living. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learned how to manage his finances because he has been trained in financial management.

He dreams of expanding his business and to buying a piece of land in the future. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to open a cereal shop.

loans.use: to open a cereal shop

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es: Adonay, tiene la edad 46 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo y tres hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos y además el  concentrado para el engorde de los mismos. Ella cuenta ya con el local donde va a tener los cerdos. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Adonay is 46 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children.  She hopes with the credit to complete the purchase of some pigs and also pig feed in order to fatten the animals.  She already has the space where she will keep the pigs.  She wants to have her animals at the ideal weight in order to sell them at the local market and in nearby areas.  She wants to generate the greatest amount of income possible for her well-being and that of her family as well as to grow in the project of raising pigs.  This is the first loan that she will receive from FUDECOSUR.  She has never had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Rosa Susana

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su madre, hermanos y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad, a quienes ama y son su razón para seguir esforzándose, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños, lamentablemente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja; gracias al apoyo de su madre y a sus deseos por superarse, Rosa pudo estudiar la carrera de Obstetricia; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Rosa puso en marcha un pequeño negocio de venta de diversos productos, como ropa, productos naturales y golosinas, ella cuenta con un kiosco donde realiza sus ventas, donde dedica un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 20 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por sus productos, precios y buena atención.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un estante, una vitrina y un poco de golosinas y productos naturales para su negocio; de esta manera Rosa podrá tener su negocio acondicionado y abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizarlos para poder adquirir su casa propia y con ello cumplir su gran sueño de ejercer su carrera profesional y lograr que sus pequeños se conviertan en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 25 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with her mother, siblings and her 2 small children who are 2 and 6 years old. She loves her children very much, they are her reason to keep going. She has always been a happy, hard working and enthusiastic person, who puts all her effort into helping her children get ahead. Sadly, for various reasons a few years ago she separated from her spouse. Thanks to the support of her mother and her personal desire to overcome she was able to study midwifery. In her spare time she likes to read and on special occasions prepare a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

As a result of her own initiative and the support of her family, Rosa was able to open a small business selling diverse products, including clothes, natural products and snacks. She has a kiosk from which she sells, working approximately 10 hours a day, assisting approximately 20 customers a day. She enjoys her work and believes that her business does well because her customers seek her out for the products she carries, for her good prices and service.  

Rosa is very thankful for Kiva loans; thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy shelves, a display case and a few snacks and natural products for her business. This will allow her to have her business in good condition and well stocked; she hopes to increase her sales, as well as her income. She wants to use her profits to buy her own home and also complete her great dream of working in the profession she studied. She wants her children to grow up to be good men.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a display case, a few snacks and natural products for her store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestros Inicios”  perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
El se dedica al rubro de venta de productos alimenticios, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que su mercadería la vende a su clientela desplazándose en su triciclo de puerta en puerta, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Temuco, en supermercados y distribuidoras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará  ají, mostaza,  Kétchup, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Jose es comprarse un vehículo para poder movilizarse sin problemas, evitando el frio durante la temporada de invierno y el calor durante la temporada de verano,  además cumplir con los pedidos de su clientela, que hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien y lo mantiene tranquilo.
Jose vive solo. Sus sueños son prósperar en su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Jose está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómodo con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad, lo cual lo motiva a seguir participando de la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Jose is part of the communal bank "Nuestros Inicios", in the city of Temuco. 

For the past 5 years he has worked in the sale of food products. He sells his merchandise to his clients by moving about door to door on his tricycle, Mondays through Saturdays following his own schedule and distributing according to his availability. He buys his products in the city of Temuco, from supermarkets and distributors, as these are places where he finds his merchandise at low cost and therefore it is economically convenient. With this loan he will buy pepper, mustard, and ketchup to stock his business.

One of Jose's goals is to buy himself a vehicle in order to move around without problems, avoid the cold during the winter and the heat during the summer, and to comply with all of his clients' orders, which up until now has been going very well. 

Jose lives alone. His dream is to prosper with his business, in order to generate greater income and in this way improve his quality of life.

Jose is very happy and grateful for the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza. Additionally, he tells us that he feels very comfortable with the meetings and communal bank group, as there is a sense of generosity and unity which serves as motivation for him to continue participating with the institution. He tells us that the trainings provided in the meetings have helped him to better invest in his business.

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucania. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Nearby there are many lake resorts (Pucon, Villarrica), and there is very attractive native flora and fauna concentrated in natural parks nearby. Also interesting to note is that 50% of the Mapuche people (an indigenous community) present in the country, are inhabitants of this region.

loans.use: to buy pepper, mustard, and ketchup to stock his business

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benigna; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y gallinas, ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y gallinas al por mayor y también para comprar alimentos para los animales. 
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Purificada de Angostura." The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The member is Benigna; she is 34 years old, cohabits with her partner and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising animals such as pigs and hens. She fattens them and makes them grow, and later sells them door to door from 8am until 6pm. She dreams of growing her business in order to raise more animals. 

Benigna asks for this loan to buy pigs and hens wholesale and to buy food for the animals. She is happy for this loan and she promises to comply with all loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy pigs and hens wholesale and to buy food for the animals

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.en: From childhood, Kholniso had a dream of being a rich woman. As she grew older, she tried to realize her dream. She decided to become a businesswoman and in this way to become rich.  Now, she is a successful businesswoman with more than 15 years of experience. She is busy with her agriculture business. She grows vegetables and corn, and sells the resulting harvest in the local market. She wants to develop her business but her income isn't enough for it. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is a successful businesswoman, but not rich. Please, help her to realize her childhood dream.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 36 años. Vive en casa de sus padres, en la localidad de Justicia Paz y Vida. Junto a sus padres esperan el nacimiento de su primer hijo, tiene 8 meses de embarazo. 
Antes que comenzará con su negocio se dedicaba a la docencia, pues es profesora. Dejó de laborar por su embarazo, pero desea retomar su carrera. En su casa tenía un cuarto, ahí pensó abrir un negocio, tenía en mente muchas ideas, pero observó que en su zona no existían muchas tiendas que vendieran frutas y en la mañana sus vecinos compran frutas para el refrigerio de sus hijos en la escuela. Por eso, con un capital mínimo, abrió su negocio de venta de frutas, poco a poco los pobladores conocieron su tienda. “Durante las mañanas tengo mucha venta, mis clientes compran las frutas porque los mantengo limpias, además tengo de todos los precios y calidades”, comenta. Ahora desea comprar vitrinas para poder mostrar sus productos, como también un refrigerador para mantenerlos frescos.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Juan Bautista” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Asegura que gracias al dinero mejorará su negocio, agradece también el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues las personas que lo integran son personas buenas, que incentivan al progreso.
Evelyn invertirá este dinero en la compra de frutas de temporada como: piña, mandarina y plátanos, en gran cantidad, para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old.  She lives at home with her parents in the locale Justicia Paz y Vida. Together with her parents, she is awaiting the birth of her first child; she is 8 months pregnant.

Before she had started her business, she had been in the field of teaching, as she is a teacher.  She ceased work because of her pregnancy, but she wants to return to her career.  In her house she has a spare room, and there she thought to open a business.  She had been coming up with many ideas, but she noticed that in her area there are not many businesses that sell fruits, and that in the morning her neighbors buy fruit for their children's snacks at school.  Therefore, with a small amount of capital, she opened a small fruit shop, and little by little the townspeople got to know her store.

"In the mornings, I have many sales.  My customers buy the fruits because I keep them clean, and also I have all different prices and qualities," she says.  She now wants to buy glass cases to show her products and also a refrigerator to keep them fresh.

She is a member of the solidarity group “San Juan Bautista” and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is certain that, thanks to this money, she will be able to improve her business, and she is also grateful for the support she has received as a part of her association because the people involved are good people who motivate her to make progress.

Evelyn will invest this money in buying seasonal fruits like pineapples, mandarin oranges, and plantains in large quantities to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, mandarin oranges, and plantains for her shop.

loans.name: Leidy Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leidy tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo fabrica puertas y ventanas.

Nuestra amiga  como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con su negocio, el esposo de nuestra amiga tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio y de fibra, taller que lo tienen en su hogar, nos cuenta que el realiza diversidad de trabajos con estos materiales como puertas, ventanas y otras cosas, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos que aprendieron en el trabajo diario del papá, llevan 15 años dedicados a este trabajo y gracias a Dios nos cuenta que casi nunca les ha hecho falta trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar aluminio vidrio, fibra y otros materiales que el utiliza para elaborar sus obras. Lleva más de cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city that is known for a large diversity of traditional products such as the Panama hats that are famous both within and outside of the country.

It is in this place where one can meet Sra. Leidy. She is 48 years old, married, and has five grown children. Two of them still live with her. Her husband makes doors and windows.

Leidy is a good wife and is taking out a loan so that she can help her husband with his business. He has a shop in their home where he works with aluminum, glass, and fiberglass. She says that he has various jobs that involve working with these materials such as making doors, windows, and other items. He works every day with the help of two of their children, who are learning the trade every day from their father. Leidy’s husband has been in this line of work for 15 years. Thanks to God, he is rarely lacking for work.

This loan will be used to buy aluminum, glass, fiber glass, and other materials that her husband needs for his work. Leidy has been with the Communal Bank for five years and enjoys being a member because of the help the loans have provided. Her dreams include continuing to improve day after day.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, glass, fiber glass, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Juana Mery

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 33 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  2 y 12 años, ella se dedica a la producción y venta de ladrillos, ella vive por la zona de Alpacoma,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de insumos y materiales  para la fabricación de ladrillos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es pedido de ladrillos que tiene que entregar y que por falta de capital no lo puede realizar, la Sra. Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existe varias ladrilleras, por ser una zona de fábricas de ladrillos, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar los beneficios en la fabricación de ladrillos por mayor, la Sra. Juana se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juana is 33 years old, married with two children who are 2 and 12 years old. She makes a living making and selling bricks. She lives in the area of Alpacoma. This is the second loan she has taken out through the communal bank. She will use this loan to buy materials and supplies to make bricks. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she has an order of bricks she needs to deliver, but for lack of capital has not been able to do so. The challenge Juana faces in her business is competition, because in the area where she lives there are various brick makers. She will use the benefits to make bricks for wholesale. She is happy and thankful for the communal bank and the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Eliana Yanina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Eliana, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que el invierta en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta  que su esposo  tiene un puesto en un Mercado en Manta, allí el trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 16h00 y que lleva diez años con su negocio, los productos los compra en el mercado a mayoristas o si no a agricultores de la zona por donde vive con lo cual le queda mejores ganancias ya que les compra más barato.

Este crédito es para comprar legumbres, naranjas, papayas, limones, etc. Lleva casi dos años  en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del mismo y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa bien terminada y más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city that is known for a large diversity of traditional products such as the Panama hats that are famous both within and outside of the country.

Sra. Eliana lives in this place. She is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 13 and 9) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

In order to help her husband, Eliana is taking out a loan to invest in his business. He sells fruits and legumes. Eliana says that her husband has a stand at a market in Manta where he works every day from 5am to 4pm. He has been in this business for 10 years. Eliana’s husband buys his products at the market from wholesalers if he is not able to obtain them from the farmers in the area where they live. He prefers the farmers because he can get a lower price and earn a better profit.

This loan will be used to buy legumes, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other products. Eliana has been with the Communal Bank for almost two years. She serves as the record keeper of the loan payments and enjoys being a member because she receives lower interest rates than those offered by other credit institutions.

Her dreams include having a larger house that is completed.

loans.use: to buy legumes, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other products.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene la edad 18 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de abarrotes para su posterior venta en la comunidad. El cuenta con el local donde desarrolla dicha actividad y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio. El quiere tener el local más surtido y con más variedad de abarrotes y así aumentar las ventas. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar y el de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge is 18 years old, is single and lives with his parents. With this loan he would like to buy groceries to later sell in his community. He has a location from which he sells, but would like to strengthen his business. He would like to better stock his location and have a better assortment of goods, thereby increasing his sales. He would like to generate greater income for the wellbeing of himself and his family. 

This is the first loan that he will receive from FUDECOSUR. Previously he has not had any loans with local banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sell groceries

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 36 years old and has three children. He is a carpenter and also sells music discs for a living. He has been in the business for seven years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a piece of land in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy music discs and furniture.

loans.use: To buy music discs and furniture

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas como chupetes, caramelos, galletas y chicles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella vende en carreta en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chupetes, caramelos, galletas y chicles. 
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the community bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE ANGOSTURA.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, a part of the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

This member is Margarita; she is 44 years old, single, and has one child.  She mixes up her daily activities with a business in sales of sweets like lollipops, caramels, cookies, and gum.  She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM, and she sells on the streets while walking around.  By means of this business, the group member is able to help her son get ahead.  Her dream is to extend her business of selling sweets.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy suckers, caramels, cookies, and gum.

She is happy about the loan and promises to complete the payments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, caramels, cookies, and gum.

loans.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció dejándola sola con sus hijos pues de esa relación tuvo 11 hijos, actualmente todos mayores de edad y  5 de ellos aun vive con ella. 

Nuestra amiga para salir adelante junto a su familia, tiene una tienda de vivees de consumo en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, una de sus hijas es la que pasa con ella atendiendo el negocio, nos comenta que tienen muchos clientes que diariamente realizan sus comprar en su local ya que les brindan un buena atención y ellos consiguen lo que necesitan en su local. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha mejorado su negocio. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city that is known for a large diversity of traditional products such as the Panama hats that are famous both within and outside of the country.

It is in this place where one can meet Sra. Rosa. She is 65 years old. Her husband died several years ago and she was left with 11 children. All of them are now adults, but five of them still live with her.

In order to move forward with her family, Rosa manages a store in her home where she offers household goods. There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruits. She works every day from 6am to 8pm, and sometimes much later. One of her daughters manages the business with her. Rosa says that she has many customers who come every day to shop because she provides good service and her store offers what they need. She has been in business for more than 10 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more inventory for her store. Rosa will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessities. She has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have improved her business.

Her dreams include continuing forward with her business and seeing her store grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Irma Judith

texts.es: Irma tiene 5 años trabajando en una papelería de su propiedad la cual ubico en Playas, cuando inicio el negocio era muy pequeño y tenia lo básico para la venta como cuadernos, plumas, y laminas en la actualidad tiene un local muy surtido. Ella agradece a Banco D-miro ya que fue la primera institución financiera que creyó en ella y en su capacidad de administración brindándole su primer crédito. Gracias a esto pudo abrir su local en las afueras de la única escuela que hay en su sector conocido como Sabana Grande y por esto sus ventas se han mejorado notablemente. El negocio lo abre antes desde las 7 de la mañana ya que a esta hora es cuando más vende hasta las 6 de la tarde, la tienda la atiende sola ya que su esposo trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda. Como sus hijos ya son mayores de edad viven solos pero si los visitan, el préstamo que está solicitando Irma es para la compra de artículos de bazar y papelería. Su meta a futuro es abrir un local más grandes con puestas corredizas e incluir una tienda en su local.
texts.en: For the past 5 years Irma has been working in a paper store that she owns, which is located in Playas. When she started the business it was very small and she only sold the most basic of supplies, like notebooks, pens and sheets of paper. Now she has a very well stocked business. She is thankful for the D-miro bank because it was the first financial institution that believed in her and in her business administration abilities, providing her with her first loan. Thanks to this loan she was able to open her business just outside the only school that is located in the area known as Sabana Grande and as a result of this her sales have increased noticably. The business is open from 7a.m., because it is at this hour that she sells the most, until 6p.m. She works in the store by herself, because her husband works as a day laborer in a estate. Her children are adults and live on their own, but come to visit. The loan that Irma is requesting is to buy bazaar items and paper supplies. Her goal for the future is to open another bigger store with small stalls, including one for her store.

loans.use: cuadernos, plumas, y laminas

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Guadalupe tiene 21 años  un hijo que tiene la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica  a la venta  de frutillas y también mermelada de frutilla en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno, ella vende junto a su hermana mayor con quien comparten el puesto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Guadalupe va utilizar este préstamo de para la compra de mas frutillas y azúcar por mayor para la elaboración de mermeladas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Guadalupe enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, la Sra. Guadalupe es una persona joven y trabajadora sola saca adelante a su familia y su deseo con el tiempo es tener una tienda donde pueda vender variedad de mermeladas  y conservas, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 21 years old and has a 2 year old son. She dedicates herself to the sale of strawberries and also strawberry jam in her vendor stall that can be found in the community of El Torno. She sells together with her older brother with whom she shares the stall. This loan is her first within the institution. Guadalupe is going to use the loan to buy more strawberries and sugar in bulk for the creation of jams. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of working capital. Guadalupe faces challenges in her business such as trying to escape poverty and she is going to use the benefits to better the quality of life for herself and her family. Guadalupe is a young person who is working hard to move her family forward and her desire over time is to have a store where she can sell a variety of jams and preserves. She feels very grateful to the institution for the opportunity provided by the award of credit.

loans.use: To buy sugar in bulk for the creation of jams

loans.name: Santa Maria

texts.es: Santa tiene 66 años y vive en la ciudad de Playas, su casa es de caña y tiene los servicios de luz, el agua la obtiene comprando por medio de tanqueros, en su zona la mayoría de las calles no están pavimentadas ni tiene alcantarillado. Santa empezó su negocio hace 5 años con una pequeña tienda, actualmente la sigue manteniendo pero con el anterior préstamo que solicito empezó la crianza de cerdos. Los compra pequeños y empieza su crianza luego de esto los vende por libras ya que de esa manera obtiene más ingresos con la proyección de seguir criando al por mayor. El trabajo de limpieza, alimentación y cuidado lo realiza sola. El costo de los animales va desde $ 150.00 los grandes y $ 80.00 los pequeños. Con el crédito que está solicitando Santa va a comprar cerdos para la crianza y una parte para la compra de productos para su tienda. Su meta a futuro es poder instalar en su domicilio criadero de cerdos grandes para que no estén a la intemperie.
texts.en:
Santa is 66 years old and lives in the city of Playas. Her house is made of reeds and she has electricity. She buys water from water trucks. Most of the streets in the area are unpaved and without drains. 

Santa began her business 5 years ago with a little store, continuing to maintain it, but with her previous loan she began raising pigs. She buys them when they are little and she begins to raise them later selling them by the pound because in this way she obtains higher earnings; she is planning to continuing raising them for wholesale. The work of cleaning, feeding and caring for them is done alone. The cost of the animals range from $150 for the largest and $80 for the smallest. Santa is asking for this loan in order to buy pigs to raise and partly to buy products for her store.

Her future goal is to be able to install on her property a large pigsty so that they are not exposed to wind and weather.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Pay Peoples Money Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Pay People Money” group from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Fatmata. Fatmata was born in Taiwama, 30 years ago. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary school. Fatmata has been selling fresh fish for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fresh fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Kimorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 64 years old, Kimorn is a widow with five children. She still supports three children who work for others for fees as they receive only minimal wage. The two-hectare of rice farming that she has been doing for 40 years is the main source of income.

Kimorn joined for her first loan with VisionFund 6 years ago. The past loans, which she completely paid back, have helped her to improve her family’s living conditions and enabled her to save some money to support her child's wedding ceremony. In a confident manner, she and two other members of her group are seeking a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan’s portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more profit and to maintain the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ozod

texts.en:
A man who is searching for new deals is Ozod. Ozod is cute and glorious. For more than 12 years he has owned a business. Ozod is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys cattle, cares for them for 3 month and then sells to local people.

Ozod loves his wife and his 2 children and always tries to do the best for them. Ozod’s house is in bad condition. He can’t do repairs to his house and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing his house. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: La Realeza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA REALEZA   Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Elva  tiene 62 años, y tiene cinco hijos todos ya independientes,  La Sra. Elva se dedica  ala actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Paurito, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elva va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de un horno de panadería industrial  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Elva va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. Elva  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Realeza” (The Royal Family) consists of eight members, seven women and one man.

The bank president is Sra. Elva. She is 62 years old and has five children who are all independent. Sra. Elva prepares and sells bread. She has a bakery that is located in the town of Paurito. The loan she is receiving is her first with Emprender. Sra. Elva will use the loan to buy an industrial oven so that she can provide better service to her customers and increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business.

By utilizing the benefits of these loans, Sra. Elva will continue to buy utensils and supplies for making bread. She is a hardworking individual and is pleased with the opportunity that has been given to her and her fellow group members. Some of them are the only ones providing support for their families.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.en: Nematullo is a man who likes to work very hard. For more than 6 years, he has been busy with his animal husbandry business. Thanks to his experience,  his business has developed year by year. He buys animals, cares for them, and then sells them to local butchers. He has many customers as his cattle are well cared-for. Through his business, Nematullo helps his brother, whom he loves very much. He is asking for a loan to buy young cattle to develop the business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle for his livestock business

loans.name: Isaka

texts.en: Isaka is 57 years old and has three children. He sells fish to earn a living. He has been in the business for twelve years and has one employee. Besides this, he also does dairy farming. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also been able to increase his sales because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location and of buying more cows in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a freezer.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La Sra. Basilia tiene 44 años y un hijos de la edad de 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio  que se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de rio seco, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Basilia  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de abarrotes, dulces y galletas por mayor para surtir su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para realizar estas compras, la Sra. Basilia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida. va a utilizar los beneficios para aumentar variedad de productos a su tienda ya que por el crecimiento de la localidad necesita tener una tienda muy surtida y así de esta manera generar más ingresos,  su objetivo a corto plazo es mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Basilia is 44 years old and has a 4 year old child. She sells staples in her neighborhood store that is located in the area of Rio Seco. 

This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Basilia is going to use this loan to buy groceries and wholesale candy and cookies in order to supply her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is that she lacks cash to make these purchases. Basilia is facing challenges in her business and in improving her quality of life. She is going to use the proceeds to increase the variety of products for her store since with the growth of the area it needs a well stocked store and in this way she can generate more income. 

Her short-term objective is to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy groceries and wholesale candy and cookies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 47-year-old married woman living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in a fishing business for 25 years now. Her husband is a fisherman himself.

Lourdes is asking for a loan worth 25,000 PHP to buy fishing equipment such as fish nets, a basin and other items, and for the repair of their boat. She works hard to support the needs of her family, especially for her six children.

In the future, Lourdes hopes to see herself successful in her business together with her family. She wants to make several investments to augment her income. She believes that in order to be successful in your own craft, you must be hardworking and innovative to reach your target in the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as fish nets, a basin and other items, and for the repair of their boat

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is Eva, 32, a mother and resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Jionvie, a driver. In addition to operating her business, she helps her husband manage their household. Eva is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eva sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. Dealers like Eva purchase customers' orders with cash. The customers then have one month to repay. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and so these profits generate the dealer's income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She does a minimum of 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue her business operations, Eva is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy merchandise and place orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Eva fervently hopes that her children will be able to finish college. She also hopes to have more sources of income. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of supplies and products.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es:
Priscila forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestros Inicios” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se  dedica al rubro de venta de chocolates, alfajores, cuchuflis, trufas, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a domingo, y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que tienes hijos pequeños.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados y distribuidoras que se especializan en ventas de chocolates, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará cobertura de chocolate, manjar, harina, ollas y moldes, para la preparación de sus chocolates.
Una de las metas de Priscila es continuar con el negocio, para contar con más recursos en el hogar, por que los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Priscila vive junto a su esposo y 5 hijos de 15, 11, 12, 9 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son ampliarse e instalar un local establecido para la ventas de sus chocolates.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta a demás que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Priscila is a member of the communal bank "Nuestros Inicios," in the city of Temuco. 

For the past 10 years she has worked in the sale of chocolates, truffles, alfajores and cuchuflis (traditional Chilean sweets). She works from home Mondays through Sundays, and distributes according to her availability as she has young children.

She buys the merchandise and ingredients that she needs from supermarkets and distributors that specialize in the sale of chocolates, as these are places where she can find her merchandise at low cost and therefore it is economically convenient.

With this loan she will buy chocolate, dulce de leche, flour, pots and molds for the preparation of her chocolates. 

One of Priscila's goals is to continue with her business, in order to have more resources for her home, as her children are growing and as they grow so does the need to provide them with a good life. 

Priscila lives with her husband and 5 children, who are 15, 12, 11, 9 and 2 years old. She dreams to grow her business and set it up in a fixed location in order to sell her chocolates. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, as this loan will enable her to invest in her business. Additionally, she feels comfortable with her communal bank group, which motivates her to continue participating in the institution. She also tells us that the trainings provided in the meetings have helped her to better invest in her business.

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucania. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). In its surroundings there are a bunch of lake resorts (Pucon, Villarrica), as well as very beautiful native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks. Also worth mentioning is that within the region live 50% of the country's Mapuche people (an indigenous community).

loans.use: to buy fudge topping, dulce de leche, flour, pots and molds for the preparation of her chocolates

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Caminando Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de las manualidades específicamente en tejidos a palillo y crochet, realizando manteles, carpetas, cuadros y ropa de vestir. Se desempeña en sus labores de manualidades desde hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, a veces la ayuda su nieta a la cual le enseño su rubro y su horario  de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que trabaja a pedido de su clientela.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras de lanas y otras veces la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por la gran variedad en lanas e hilos  a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará lanas, cola fría, tachuelas, hilos, agujas, bastidores para la confección de sus cuadros, tejidos y vestuario.
Una de las metas de Julia es tener un capital para tener una  botillería instalada en su propia casa, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida y dejar sus manualidades como hobbies.
Julia en estos momentos vive sola, tiene 2 hijos en el cual cada uno tiene su familia y comenta que a fin de año se casará. Sus sueños son contar con buena salud para disfrutar de su negocio y disfrutar de su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que son como una familia son generosas y unidas.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Julia is part of the “Caminando Juntos” communal bank located in the city of Rancagua.

She works in the handicrafts sector, specifically knitting and crochet, and makes tablecloths, doilies, pictures and clothing.

She has been doing her handicrafts work for four years. She works from Monday to Saturday. Sometimes her granddaughter, to whom she taught her  occupation, helps her. She divides her work hours according to her availability, as she works on the basis of orders from her clientele.

She buys her merchandise at wool distributors, and at other times buys it in the city Santiago, because of the great variety of wools and threads that are available at low cost, and therefore affordable.  

With the loan she will buy wools, glue, tacks, thread, needles, as well as stretchers for making her pictures, weavings and clothing.

One of Julia's goals is to have a bit of capital in order to set up a liquor store in her own home, and with this, choose a better quality of life and leave her crafts as hobbies.

Julia lives alone at the present time. She has two children, each of whom has their own family and says that she be getting married at the end of the year.

Her dream is to have good health in order to enjoy her business and her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as it has allowed her to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group, as they are like a close-knit family. 

Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins region. This modern city is a principal center for the production and export of Chilean fruit and wine. It is also a mining city, as the world's largest underground mine, "El Teniente," with its 4,500 km of tunnels, is located in its mountain range.

loans.use: To buy wools, glue, tacks, thread, needles and stretchers for making her pictures, weavings and clothing.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 46 años. Desde hace 20 años vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, en la localidad de Yanamarca; ahí conformó su familia, junto a su esposo Arturo y sus dos hijos: Frank y Marisol. 
Desde joven se dedicó a la agricultura, sembrando diversos productos como papa, cebada y hortalizas en general. También aprendió a la ganadería, ahora posee vacas, toros, ovejas y cuyes, de los que obtiene buenos resultados. Los compra a un menor precio, según pasan los meses los va cuidando, alimentando y nutriendo para que se encuentren saludables y así pueda venderlos a un mayor precio en la feria que se realiza los días domingos en la ciudad, o en ocasiones, llegan los carniceros a su misma casa. Hace 4 años, también abrió en su casa, una tienda de comestibles, donde vende alimentos de primera necesidad, verduras y carnes, ya tiene muchos clientes y espera poder dentro de estos meses surtir su tienda con más productos y así tener contentos a sus compradores, “tienen que encontrar todo lo que piden cuando ingresan a mi tienda”, menciona. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Marcelina invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de un toro y si el dinero le alcanza surtirá su tienda de comestibles con sacos de arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 46 years old.  For the past 20 years, she has lived in the home she inherited from her parents, in the area of Yanamarca.  There she has made a family with her spouse Arturo and has two children, Frank and Marisol.

Since she was young, she has worked in agriculture, sowing different products, like potatoes, barley, and vegetables of many types.  She has also learned to raise poultry, and now has cows, bulls, sheep, and guinea pigs, with which she has had good returns.  She buys them at a lower price, then spends a few months caring for them, feeding them, and giving them good nutrition so they will be healthy, and then she goes to sell them at a better price in the markets which happen on Sundays in the city, or at times the butchers come to her house for them.  

About four years ago, she also opened a small grocery store in her home, where she sells food staples, vegetables, and meats, and she has many customers and hopes in a few months to stock her store with more products and thereby satisfy her consumers.  "They need to find everything they ask for when they come into my store," she says.

She is a member of the community bank “Corazón de Jesús” and this will be her fifth loan through MFP.  She really likes the work that she does with the association, since she receives support from the other members, who look out for the welfare of each and every member.  "At each meeting we always contribute our funds responsibly," she notes.  

Marcelina will invest the money from her loan in buying a bull, and if there is enough left over she will stock her grocery store with sacks of rice and sugar as well.

loans.use: to buy a bull as well as sacks of rice and sugar for her grocery store.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 29 years old. He supports three people in his family. He is married to Angela and together they have one child who is one year old.

Moses has been in the electrical repair business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. The purpose of the loan is to purchase computers for a cybercafe. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his business by purchasing additional computers.

This is his second loan cycle from KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and to provide a quality life for his family.

loans.use: to buy computers for his cybercafe.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a resident of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with six children, ages 8, 10, 13, 17, 20, and 22. Lina's husband works as a carpenter while she cooks food to sell. She usually make tarts and delivers them to different stores and neighborhoods. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and margarine. Lina is hoping that, through a better income, she will be able to send her children to school. Their education is important to her, so her income will be used to pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and margarine

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 49-year-old married woman living Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in a fishing business with her husband for three years now. She sells her husband's catch in their community. 

Sylvia is applying for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy fishing equipment such as fishnets, basins, and ropes. Sylvia works very hard to support her husband in meeting their needs. In the future, she hopes to buy a new fishing boat so that she will have more fish to sell in the market. In addition, she wants to invest in some businesses to earn additional income. Some of their revenue will be saved for future use.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for fishing such as fishnets, basins, and ropes

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eulogia; la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganadería,la socia cria vacas para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de una vaca.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "IMA SUMAC SUNCCO." The bank is located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Eulogia. She is 27 years old, cohabits with her partner, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising livestock, and raises cows to later sell them to clients who order them. She has been doing this for many years, and it has been going very well due to the great effort that she puts into her business every day. At the same time, she works in the buying and selling of vegetables, and in this way works to get her family ahead.

This member is asking for the loan to buy a cow.

She is very happy for the loan, and promises to repay all payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y un hijo,  de los cuales unos estudian. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar una máquina para coser y hacer ropa intima y un poco de ropa deportiva. Ella tiene pensado hacer variedad de ropa para su posterior venta en el mercado local y lugares aledaños y también arreglar ropa a los vecinos   y así  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad economica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María Elena is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband and one son who studies. She would like this loan to buy a sewing machine to make underwear and sportswear. She is thinking of making a variety of clothing for later sale in the local market and surrounding areas, and she also plans to fix her neighbors' clothing in order to earn more money and obtain a better quality of life and economic stability. This is the first loan that she is receiving from FUDECOSUR. She has not previously had any loans with local banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan with greater ease and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Lorelie has been in this business for 5 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 51 años. Desde hace 25 años vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, ubicada en la localidad de Tambo Paccha. Ahí conformó su familia, ahora vive junto a su esposa Nélida y uno de sus siete hijos; Jorge. 

Desde hace 30 años comenzó su trabajo en la agricultura, en todo este tiempo pudo sembrar distintos productos como habas, papa, alverjas y otras hortalizas. Por ello se siente muy dichoso al ver como sus cosechas son muy cotizadas entre los comerciantes de la localidad. Alfredo siembra en extensas hectáreas de terreno agrícola que le fueron heredados de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que hoy sabe del campo. Cuenta que tienen que invertir un promedio de 7 mil a 10 mil soles para comenzar a sembrar, por ello le resulta un poco difícil conseguir la totalidad del capital, ya que es la única actividad con la que solventa sus gastos económicos. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias para poseer un capital mayor y de esa manera sembrar en mayor cantidad. Aprovecha su trabajo para la crianza de ovejas, vacas y toros que engorda para luego vender a los carniceros.  

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Productores” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Durante todos estos años logró obtener grandes beneficios, como mejorar su producción de leche y la siembra. Por ese motivo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Alfredo invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 30 bolsas de fertilizantes naturales y semilla de habas, que muy pronto sembrará.
texts.en:
Thirty years ago Alfredo started farming and over the years he has grown different crops such as beans, potatoes, peas, and other vegetables. He feels very fortunate to see how his produce is much sought after by local store keepers. He grows the crops on the extensive parcel of land he inherited from his parents who taught him all he knows today about farming. 

Alfredo explains that an average of 7,000 to 10,000 soles has to be invested at the beginning of the season--a sum that is difficult to get hold of, but farming is the only way he can afford household expenses. Now he wishes to increase his income by buying more seeds and planting more crops. He also wishes to raise sheep, cows, and bulls to later sell to butchers.

Alfredo belongs to the Productores group. This will be his fifth loan with MFP. Over these years he has derived many benefits from the loans such as increasing production of milk and produce. He promises to make his repayments on time.

With this loan he will buy 30 bags of natural fertilizer, as well as bean seeds which he will plant immediately.

loans.use: buy 30 bags of natural fertilizer and bean seeds

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita tiene 43 años y tiene  3 hijos que son de las edades de 3,  6 y 12 años, los dos mayores se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería que se encuentra en la localidad de Rio Seco,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Benita va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de empanadas y galletas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Benita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, su deseo es poder tener una cafetería donde pueda ofrecer también sus deliciosas masitas a toda su clientela.
texts.en:
Benita is 43 years old and has 3 children (ages 3, 6, and 12); the two oldest children are school age. She makes a living making and selling a variety of pastries in her bakery that is located in the city of Rio Seco.

This loan is her first loan cycle within the institution. Benita is going to use the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and yeast for baking her empanadas and cookies. Her reason for asking for this loan is because of a lack of capital.

Benita faces challenges in her business such as improving the quality of her life. She is going to use the profits to increase her production level.

Her wish is to one day have a cafe where she can also offer her delicious pastries to all of her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel , de 50 años de edad , soltera, con tres hijos, tiene por activiadad  economica la venta de meracaderia en general , negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion , herramienta de trabajo que surgio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para sus familia,en la actulidad gracias a su responsabilidad  y ganas de superacion es que ha podido cumplir sueños y metas personales como es terminar su casa, y que sus hijos sean profesionales, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para invertir en mercaderia como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa de niño, sandalias, cosmeticos entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 50 years old. She is single and has three children. Her business is selling general merchandise, and she has a store located in her home. 

This is a livelihood that came about through the necessity of having income for her family. Currently, thanks to her responsible attitude and desire for self-improvement, she has been able to fulfill her dreams and personal goals, including finishing her house, and helping her children become professionals.

She wants the loan in order to buy merchandise such as: pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, sandals, cosmetics and other goods.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, sandals, cosmetics and other goods.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Lucena works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.  Lucena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her 7 previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en: Bahodur is very hard-working man. Twenty years ago he organized own agricultural business, which keeps him busy. He cares for livestock both large and small. Thanks to his many years of experience, his business has developed year by year. He has a lovely wife and 2 children. He wants to comfort them with all of the modern conveniences. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing his house. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en: Noeurn, 51, has a big family of 8 children living in a rural village of Thmor Koul district, Battambang Province.  Six of the 8 children still need her support as some of them are still at school while others are paid workers with minimal income. To support this big family, she has been working on one-hectare of farmland, growing rice.  She supplements the family's daily needs by selling water. This is the third loan cycle for Noeurn.  She leads a group of other two members, one is also on her third loan cycle while another one is a newly joined client. The past two loans have helped Noeurn to save some money for her child's wedding. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase fertilizer and hire a laborer for plowing. She hopes to gain more crop yield and make a better living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire a laborer for plowing

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina is 29 years old and owns a barn near her house in Cortes, Bohol. She raises pigs in order to meet the needs of her three children ages 2, 7 and 9. Rina's husband works as a driver to provide for them, but Rina is determined to help through her hog raising. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her hogs. Quality feed will ensure that Rina's hogs grow healthy and easy to market in a few months. She hopes that she will be able to uplift her family's living condition through her profits. Her income will be used to give her family a nutritious diet, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Join Hands Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Join Hands” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is 41 years old and married with 3 children who are attending primary school. Fatmata sells palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), soft drinks, water, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, soft drinks, water, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 40 years old, married, and has one child. He runs a taxi transport business in a competitive environment to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed two people. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to acquire more taxis in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy tires.

loans.use: To buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Ahmed M.s.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Kenema. Teachers at this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 9,100,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve their standard of living. 

Staff from this school, like many other schools' staffs within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish on their salaries alone. With the help of loans, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use their loans to buy furniture, a plot of land, or house-building materials, or they can invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-one-year-old Philip is the leader of this group of teachers. Philip was born in a place called Feiba Lugbu. He is married to a trader and has 4 children, 2 of whom are attending secondary school. Philip has been a teacher for 31 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy materials for the construction of a family house: bags of cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, and other items.

loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Luzmira

texts.es:
Luzmira forma parte del Banco Comunal “Luz y esperanza” perteneciente a la comuna de la Florida, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro en venta de comida rápida, desde hace 20 años. Comenta que su negocio lo ubica en su casa, trabaja de lunes a miércoles y de viernes a sábado de 8ºº hasta las 17ºº horas, el día sábado le ayuda en las ventas su nuera.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados y en el bario Franklin comuna de la ciudad de Santiago, que se caracteriza por vender todo tipo de mercadería e insumos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará vienesas, churrascos, tomate, queso, jamón, palta y papas.
Una de las metas de Luzmira es ampliar su negocio, instalar un baño y un lava manos, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Luzmira vive con su esposo quien trabaja de mueblista y 2 hijos del cual uno se encuentra estudiando y el otro trabajando. Sus sueños es continuar con su negocio, y tener la posibilidad de vender otros productos como artículos de aseo.
Luzmira está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
Luzmira is part of the communal bank "Luz y Esperanza" in the community of la Florida, located in the city of Santiago.

She has worked in the sale of fast food for the past 20 years. She has her business located in her home, and works from Monday through Wednesday and Friday through Saturday from 8am to 5pm. On Saturdays she helps her daughter-in-law with her sales.

She buys the merchandise and ingredients that she needs in supermarkets and in the Franklin neighborhood in Santiago, which is known for selling all kinds of merchandise and ingredients at low cost and is therefore economically convenient. 

With this loan she will by sausages, meats, tomatoes, cheese, ham, avocados and potatoes. 

One of Luzmira's goals is to grow her business, install a bathroom and wash bin, and generate greater income, thereby generating a better quality of life. 

Luzmira lives with her husband who works making furniture and their two children, one of whom is working and one who is studying. She dreams to continue with her business and have the possibility to sell other products such as toiletries. 

Luzmira is very happy and grateful for the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza. She also tells us that she is very comfortable with the meetings of her communal bank, as there exists great generosity and unity within the group. With respect to the trainings that she has received at the meetings, she has learned how to administer her business better. 

La Florida is a community located in the southeast of Santiago, the capital and metropolitan region of Chile. It's present population is very diverse, representing all socioeconomic classes (high, medium high, medium, and medium low). The area has a very active commercial life, which manifests itself in the presence of of various new commercial centers. It is an area that has had explosive demographic growth in the past few years.

loans.use: to buy sausages, meats, tomatoes, cheese, jam, avocados and potatoes

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
This is Irish, 31, a mother and resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Joey, a sidecar driver. In addition to operating the business, she manages the household with her husband.

Irish operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages to residents of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Irish is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and supplies to maintain her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Irish hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all of her hard work. She also hopes to give her children a good and high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products for her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
Linda tiene 42 años. Vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 18 años, en la localidad de Yanamarca. Ahí cuido a sus cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con cuatro de ellos.   

Ella es una mujer de muchas ocupaciones; en las mañanas se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, en temporadas agrícolas siembra trigo, cebada y cebolla, los que cuida con mucha dedicación, pues tiene que aprovechar las temporadas de cosecha. Pero la actividad que desarrollo por más de 18 años es la ganadería, cuenta con cerdos, ovejas y cuyes, asimismo posee tres vacas de raza, las que diariamente les produce 80 litros de leche, que es vendida a una empresa procesadora de leche en lata, muy reconocida en el país. “Mis animales tienen que estar en buen estado, no es fácil mantener la cantidad de producción, tienen que tomar vitaminas, comida sana, por ello quiero comprar una vaca más y así mejorar la cantidad de leche”, afirma.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Linda invertirá este dinero en la compra de una vaca de calidad para mejorar su ganado y producción de leche.
texts.en:
Linda is 42 years old. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents 18 years ago, in the town of Yanamarca. There she cared for her five children, but now only four are living with her.

She is a woman with many occupations. In the morning she works in her grocery store. During agricultural season she plants wheat, barley and onions, caring for them with great dedication, so that she can take advantage of the harvest season. But the activity that she developed more than 18 years ago is livestock farming. She has pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and also she owns three cows that daily produce 80 liters of milk which is sold to a canned milk processing company, very well known in the country. “My animals have to be in good condition. It is not easy to maintain the quantity of production. They have to take vitamins and eat healthy food so I want to buy another cow and thus increase the amount of milk,” she says.

She belongs to the communal bank “Corazón de Jesús” and this is their fifth loan through MFP.
