She likes the work that is done within the association, she receives the help of all the members, who look after the wellbeing of each one. “At each meeting we always contribute the fees responsibly,” she says. 

Linda will invest this money in the purchase of a cow to improve the quality of her livestock and production of milk.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock and her milk production

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; la socia tiene 25 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez vende verduras en uno de los mercados del Cusco, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the communal bank IMA SUMAC SUNCCO. The bank is located in the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Carlota is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities in her business where she raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She raises these small animals in order to later sell them to her customers that ask for them. Carlota also sells vegetables in one of the markets in Cusco. In this way she is able to to support her family.

Carlota is asking for this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

She is very happy because of the loan and is committed to make the payments on the loan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon and the father of one child. He has been working as a blacksmith for four years. Mouhamad has requested a YOUTH LOAN from Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his pickup, buy iron, and renew his tools, which are necessary for his work and makes it easier. 

This is Mouhamad’s sixth loan with Al Majmoua, and he has proven to be a borrower in good standing through his timely repayments. Mouhamad believes that this loan will improve his work and expand his business territory. He hopes to cover a wider region, to expand his income, and to provide his family with the best living possible. He is very happy with the results of his previous loans, and he is sure that this one will also have impressive effects on his business.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his pickup, buy iron, and renew his tools

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a retail shop for a living, and she has been in the business for twenty years. She also does crop farming to generate extra income. Lilian previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She has also been able to expand her business because she has been trained in business management. She hopes to own a wholesale business in the future. She has requested a loan of 90,000 KES to buy wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sheyla Vanesa

texts.es:
Sheyla tiene 23 años de edad, junto a su pareja tiene un pequeño de 2 años de edad, a quien quiere y ama muchísimo y por quien cada día trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, la ciudad de Ica se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, EN Ica podemos encontrar uno de sus atractivos turísticos más visitado el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual se encuentra en medio de maravillosas dunas en las cuales se practican deportes de aventura, en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Sheyla en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho escuchar música, sobre todo porque la relaja mucho y la anima, asimismo le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Sheyla solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser una buena enfermera.

Con su carisma característicos y sobre todo sus ganas de salir adelante hacen que Sheyla trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio de venta de humitas, tamales y chocotejas, las cuales unos dulces y comidas típicas de nuestro país, ella trabaja alrededor de 7 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15  clientes al día; tambien cuenta con una mototaxi, la cual alquila y con ello tiene un ingreso adicional para los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y sobre todo porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Sheyla está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar mantenimiento general, compra de puertas para su mototaxi, con esta mejora ella podrá tener un vehículo más seguro y también podrá comprar algunos insumos como maíz, ají panca, carne de cerdo al por mayor para poder preparar sus platillos, de esta manera sus ingresos podrán ir mejorando y podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Sheyla is 23 years old, and with her partner has a little one who is 2 years old, who she loves and adores greatly, and for whom she works hard every day to get ahead.  Her home is located in the city of Ica.  

The city of Ica is characterized by its hot climate and friendliness.  In Ica we find one of the most well-visited tourist attractions, which is the "Laguna de Huacachina" (Lake Huacachina), located in the midst of marvelous dunes in which adventure sports can be practiced.  In this city, there is a lot of agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, grapes, asparagus, and paprika, among others.

Sheyla, in her free time, really enjoys listening to music; more than anything else, it really relaxes her and makes her happy.  She also likes to eats her favorite food, which is the delicious "Arroz con Pollo" (Chicken and Rice).  Due to her economic condition, Sheyla only had a secondary school education, but she would have liked to study to be a good nurse.

With her characteristic charisma and her great desire to get ahead in life, Sheyla works very hard in her little business selling humitas (corn leaf wrapped corn dumplings), tamales (a cornmeal, meat, and sauce concoction), and chocotejas (chocolate covered candies), which are sweets and other traditional foods of our country.  She works around 7 hours a day and can assist up to 15 customers each day.  She also has a mototaxi, which she rents out, and with this gains an additional income to cover the expenses of her household.  She believes that her business is going well because she uses great flavors and seasonings, and more than anything because she is friendly to her customers.

Sheyla is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to do general maintenance, and buy doors for her mototaxi, and with this improvement she will have a more secure vehicle and she will also be able to buy some ingredients like corn, Panca peppers, and pork in bulk to prepare her dishes.  This will help to increase her income, and she will be able to continue working and fighting to make her greatest dream a reality, "to have her own house and give her child a good education."

loans.use: to buy ingredients (Panca peppers, corn, and others), general maintenance, to buy a door, and other uses.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: Ligia de Socorro  de 52 años de edad del municipio de managua, estado civil soltera, numero de hijos 3, tiempo de tener el negocio 6 años, su actividad economica es mercaderia en general, en la actulidad esta solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de mercaderia como: camisas, pantalones, short, camisetas, faldas, toallas, jugos de sabanas, calzados, cosmeticos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Ligia de Socorro is 52, and from the municipality of Managua. She is single, and has three children. She has had her business for six years and sells general merchandise.

At this time, she is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise such as: shirts, pants, shorts, T-shirts, skirts, towels, sets of sheets, footwear, cosmetics and other goods.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as: shirts, pants, shorts, T-shirts, skirts, towels, sets of sheets, footwear, cosmetics and other goods.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza” perteneciente a la comuna de la Florida, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro de almacén, se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 9:30 hasta las 23ºº horas, su almacén lo ubica en una parte de su casa, a veces la ayuda su marido o su hijo.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados, distribuidoras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos, bebidas, lácteos, cecinas, cloro, para abastecer su almacén.
Una de las metas de Paulina es poner una carnicería junto con su almacén, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
Paulina vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14, y 9 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son trasladar su negocio a la comuna de Puente Alto (ciudad ubicada en Santiago) ya que ahí cuenta con un departamento y tiene espacio suficiente para su almacén y carnicería, y quedaría con su casa con más espacio para vivir con su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
Paulina is part of the communal bank "Luz y Esperanza" in the community of la Florida, located in the city of Santiago. 

She has worked in the sale of grocery items for the past year. She works Monday through Sunday from 9:30am until 11pm, and her store is located in her home so sometimes her husband and son help her.

She buys the merchandise and ingredients that she needs in supermarkets and from distributors, as these are places where she can find her merchandise at low cost and therefore it is economically convenient.

With this loan she will buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, juice, drinks, milk, sausages and bleach in order to stock her shop. 

One of Paulina's goals is to put a butcher shop with her store, so she can generate more income, and in this way provide a better quality of life for her family.

Paulina lives with her husband and their two children who are 14 and 9 years old and are studying. She dreams of moving her business to the Puente Alto neighborhood (in Santiago) and hopes to find an apartment there with sufficient space for her store and butcher shop so her family will have more space in their current house to live. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has provided for her to invest in her business. Additionally, she feels very comfortable with the group in which she participates, as there is great unity, respect and confidence within the group.

La Florida is a community located in the southeast of Santiago, the capital and metropolitan region of Chile. It's current population is very diverse, representing all socioeconomic classes (high, medium-high, medium and medium-low). The area has a very active commercial life, which manifests itself in the presence of various new commercial centers. It is an area that has had explosive demographic growth in the past few years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, juice, drinks, milk, sausages, and bleach to stock her shop

loans.name: Karen Carolina

texts.es:
Karen es una joven de 23 años, soltera, vive junto a sus padres, de condición muy sencilla, le ha tocado mucho esfuerzo terminar sus estudio el año pasado, saco su titulo de Licenciada en contabilidad, ayudándose con su trabajo de cajera en un banco, su titulo lo pago con préstamos, muy sastifecha al poder concluir parte de sus estudios en este momento, ya que su objetivo es seguir estudiando.
Hoy que ya cancelo su crédito, está optando por hacer mejora a su casa, siendo muy insegura y de zinc viejo, el cual desea mejorar la infraestructura en comenzar a construir el arranque de concreto hasta donde llegue, en donde irá por parte ya que los materiales de construcción están ah altos costos. Materiales a comprar: piedra, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman of 23 years old, single, who lives with her parents in very simple conditions. She has put a lot of effort into finishing her studies during the past year, and she received her degree in accounting which helps her in her job as a bank teller. She paid for her degree with loans, and is very satisfied to have concluded this part of her studies for the moment, as she would like to continue studying in the future. 

As she has paid back these previous loans, she would now like to improve her house as it is very unsafe and made of old zinc, so she wishes to improve the infrastructure and will start with constructing concrete walls little by little as the construction costs are very high. 

She will buy stone, blocks, sand, cement, iron, and tables to begin the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to begin making the walls of her house concrete

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 42 años. Vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, hace 18 años, en la localidad de Yanamarca. Ahí cuidó de sus cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos: Max y Axel.   
Aprovechó la ubicación de su casa para vender gasolina, pues se ubica en plena carretera central. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo pudo vencer a la competencia. Pero no es está a la actividad que más tiempo la dedica, pues también siembra, desde hace 15 años, cebada, habas y papa en terrenos alquilados y propios. Vende la papa de buena calidad, separando las pequeñas y arrugadas, de ellas extrae la conocida “papa seca”, proceso típico en su región. “Tienes que extraer esa calidad de papa, para luego secarla durante varios meses, se compacta y sirve para realizar varios platos típicos, que contienen muchas proteínas”. Según menciona Marilú, vende cada saco a 80 soles promedio, por ello quiere comprar cantidad de papa y así realizar el proceso hasta el mes de diciembre donde costará más.  

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Marilu invertirá este dinero en la compra de 100 sacos de papa para realizar el proceso del secado.
texts.en:
Marilu is 42 years old. She lives in the home she inherited from her parents 18 years ago, which is in Yanamarca. There, she raised five children but now she only lives with two of them: Max and Axel.

She took advantage of the location of her house to sell gasoline, since it is right by a central road. She already has eight years experience and she has been able to beat the competition. However, this is not the job she dedicates the most time to; she also plants barley, beans, and potatoes. She has been doing so for 15 years on rented land as well as her own. She sells high-quality potatoes, separating the small and wrinkled ones. From those she removes, she uses the well-know "dry potato" process, which is typical in the region. "You have to remove that type of potato and then dry them for a few months, flatten them and serve them in various typical dishes. They contain a lot of protein." According to Marilu, she sells each sack for an average of 80 soles. Therefore, she wants to buy a large quantity of potatoes to complete this process before December, when it will cost more.

She belongs to the Corazón de Jesús communal bank and this is her sixth credit with MFP. She really likes the work she does for the association. She receives help from the other members, who watch out for each other. "At each meeting, we always handle the payments responsibly," she says.

Marilu will invest this money in buying 100 sacks of potatoes to complete this dry potato process.

loans.use:
Compra de 100 sacos de papa para procesarla
to buy 100 sacks of potatoes to process

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de abarrotes, leña, carbón, desde hace 4 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 7ºº hasta las 23ºº horas, su negocio lo ubica en su propia casa.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Temuco y otras veces en la ciudad de Concepción en  supermercados y distribuidoras ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará leña, papas, carbón, bebidas y verduras, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Sonia es continuar con el negocio y agregar otras provisiones,  para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Sonia vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo verduras, su madre, y 2 hijos, uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando y el otro trabajando. Sus sueños son poder arreglar el piso  y cambiar unas puertas de su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de  la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Sonia is part of the communal bank "Las Estrellas" in the city of Temuco. 

She has worked in the sale of groceries, firewood and charcoal for the past 4 years. She works Monday through Sunday from 7am until 11pm, and her business is located in her home. 

She buys her merchandise in the city of Temuco and sometimes in the city of Concepcion in supermarkets or from distributors as these are places she can buy at low cost and it therefore makes sense economically. 

With this loan she will buy firewood, potatoes, charcoal, drinks and vegetables to stock her business. 

One of Sonia's goals is to continue with her business and add other provisions, in order to generate greater income and therefore improve her quality of life. 

Sonia lives with her husband who works selling vegetables, her mother, and two children, one of whom is studying and one of whom is working. Her dreams are to fix up her apartment and change the doors of her business.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, which has permitted her to invest in her business. Additionally she feels very comfortable with the company and other entrepreneurs that she has found in her communal bank group, as they share different activities and interests which serve as a nice distraction. As a result of the trainings she has received during the meetings she has learned to better manage her business. 

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucania. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (capital of Chile). It is surrounded by many lake resorts (Pucon, Villarrica) and has a lot of beautiful local floral and fauna in natural parks nearby. Additionally, this region is home to 50% of the country's Mapuche people (an indigenous community).

loans.use: to buy firewood, potatoes, charcoal, drinks and vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Flora Del Carmen

texts.es: Flora del Carmen de 64 años de edad, del municipio de managua tiene por actividad economica la venta de cerdos , en el cual tiene 31 años de experiencia, el negocio lo aprendio de su padre el cual se dedicaba a la actividad  y con el tiempo se le dejo a su hija para que se hiciera cargo del negocio, en la actualidad ella ha demostrado su capacidad en el negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo y  tenacidad, el cual le ha permito  invertir en e negocio como es la compra de un camion para transportar los cerdos, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar cerdos y venderlos a sus clientes fijos y eventuales
texts.en:
Flora del Carmen is 64 years old. She is from the city of Managua. She makes a living selling pigs—which she has been doing for 31 years. She learned the business from her father who worked doing the same thing. With the course of time he left her in charge of the business.

At present she has demonstrated her abilities in the business. Thanks to her hard work and tenacity she has been able to invest in her business with the purchase of a truck to transport the pigs.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy pigs to sell them to her current and future customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell them to current and future customers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 50 años. Vive en la casa que compró hace 25 años en la localidad de Yanamarca. Conformó su familia junto a su esposo Becker y sus cinco hijos, de los que ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos; Jonathan.  
Ella es una mujer muy ocupada, se dedica de lleno a las actividades agrícolas. Su esposo es músico y toca el saxo en diversas orquestas. Durante las mañanas, ella se encarga del cuidado de su tienda de comestibles, ya por la tarde cuida de sus sembríos de papa, haba, cebada y alverja, los que siembra en terrenos alquilados, pues no posee unos propios. Pero la actividad en la que invertirá este dinero es la ganadería, desde hace 20 años comenzó con el cuidado de ovejas, vacas, toros y cuyes. Su trabajo consiste en cuidarlos, engordarlos y venderlos a un buen precio. Esto lo realiza cada tres meses, por lo que tiene que dedicarles mucho tiempo en la alimentación, ya que cuando se encuentran más sanos y en buen estado, tienen mayor precio. Norma es una mujer con mucha fuerza, desea para el futuro aumentar su ganando, comenzar a producir ella misma, tener toros de raza y vacas de calidad.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Norma invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de un toro para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
50-year old Norma lives in the house she bought 25 years ago in the community of Yanamarca. She lives with her husband Becker and the only one of their five children, Jonathan, who still lives with them. Norma is a very busy woman, earning her living through farming. Her husband is a musician who plays the saxophone in various bands. In the mornings Norma tends her grocery store, and in the afternoons she takes care of her potato, bean, barley, and pea crops which she grows on rented land as she doesn't have any of her own.

She wishes to use the money from this loan to buy cattle. Twenty years ago she started raising sheep, cows, cattle, and guinea pigs. She takes care of them, fattens them, and then sells them for a good price every three months. Feeding them all takes a lot of time  as when the animals are healthy and in good condition, she gets a better price for them.

Norma is a woman with a lot of energy. Her hope for the future is to increase her income by having quality cattle and milk cows.

She belongs to the Corazón de Jesús Community Bank, and this will be her fifth loan with MFP. She greatly enjoys the services provided by the organization and the support provided by the members who look out for each other. 'We always bring the money we owe to each meeting,' she notes. She plans to use this loan money to buy another bull for her herd.

loans.use: Buy a bull

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has an adult son who is independent. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been selling kerosene from home. Her main customers are family members, friends and neighbors in the area. Thanks to this business the quality of life in her home has improved considerably since she’s been able to sustain herself. 

Because her sales are good, Fatuma needs a loan to buy gallons of kerosene for resale. In this way she will be able to meet customer demand and continue generating income for her home that will give her the opportunity of having a better quality of life at home and better opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a very careful mother. She has three children, and she loves her children very much. 

Five years ago, she began her own business. She is busy with the selling of children's shoes.  In the local market, she has her own selling place and a lot of customers.  Her experience helps her to be successful in business. 

She wants to develop her business, but her income isn't enough for it.  She is asking a loan to buy goods for the new season. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is 30 years old and has one child.  He runs a taxi transport business for a living. He operates his business in a challenging and competitive business environment. He also does dairy farming to generate extra income.  He previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him to expand his business. He understands how to manage his business because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of buying his own car and owning a company in the future. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Moiwai's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Kenema. Teachers at this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve their standard of living. 

Fifty-two-year-old Moiwai is the leader of this group of teachers. Moiwai was born in a place call Kamboma. He is married and has 5 children who attend secondary and tertiary institutions. Moiwai has been a teacher for 27 years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, robs, etc., for the construction of a family house. 

Staff from this school, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish on their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, robs, etc., for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Isabel; la socia tiene 45 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia vende lo que son cebollas, zanahorias, lechugas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the community bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.”  The bank is located in the province of Cusco and part of the department of Cusco.
	
This member is named Isabel, and she is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  She varies her daily activities working in a business buying and selling vegetables.  She sells her products in one of the markets in the city of Cusco, selling onions, carrots, lettuce, and others.  She has spent a great deal of time in this line of work and by these means helps her family to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy carrots in bulk.

The bank member is happy about her loan and promises to pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy carrots in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his vegetable business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 19 años. Desde hace 19 años vive en la localidad de Tambo Paccha, en la casa que compró su padre, allí vive en compañía de sus hermanos y padres.  
A pesar de su corta edad se dedica a la siembra de diversos productos. Desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y a vivir de ella, “me gusta mucho poder ayudar a mis padres, disfruto del campo, es tranquilo”, afirma. Es por ello que en los terrenos que tienen sus padres comenzó a sembrar papa, alverja, habas y otras hortalizas, las que abona con ayuda de sus hermanos, quienes constantemente se encuentran fertilizando y sembrando sus terrenos. Ahora, se encuentra en la siembra grande, por ello quiere invertir la mayor cantidad de capital que tiene, pues sabe que en la cosecha de enero, podrá obtener buenos resultados, pues ya tiene comprador en la ciudad.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Productores” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Durante todos estos años logró obtener grandes beneficios, como mejorar su producción de leche y la siembra, que lograron que aumente sus ganancias. Por ese motivo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Esther invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para distribuirlos entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Esther is 19 years old. She has lived with her siblings and parents her whole life in Tambo Paccha in the house bought by her father. In spite of her youth she grows various crops . From a young age she learned from her parents how to work the land and earn a living from it. 'I really like to help my parents, and I enjoy being out in the peaceful countryside,' she says. For these reasons she she started growing potatoes, peas, beans, and other vegetables in her parents' fields. With help from her siblings she also spreads fertilizer on the fields as they always do. Now she is in the main planting season so she wants to invest all her money so that in January she will have a good harvest. She already has a buyer for the produce in the town.

Esther belongs to the Productores Community Bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  Over this time she has had many benefits from the loans such as increasing production of milk and produce which has led to an increased income. She promises to make her repayments on time.

Esther plans to use the loan money to buy 20 bags of natural fertilizer to spread on her potato fields.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Michael Momoh's Group

texts.en:
These men are teachers at a primary school in Kenema. Teachers from this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 6,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Fifty-year-old Michael is the leader of this group of teachers. Michael was born in Kenema. He is married to a housewife, and the couple has two children. Michael has been a teacher for 35 years. He has requested this loan to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, corrugated iron, nails, etc., for the construction of a family house. 

Staff from this school, like staff from many other schools within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish tasks that they would otherwise not be able to on their salaries alone. With the help of these loans, some can pay school fees for their children.  Others can use the loan to buy furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. 

At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a family house

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juliana; la socia tiene 59 años de edad, casada y tiene 7 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras , la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, a la vez la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes  para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negoció.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member is a part of the community bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.”  The bank is located in the province and department of Cusco.

The woman's name is Juliana, and she is 59 years old, married, and has 7 children.  She spends her days in buying and sales of vegetables.  She sellsin one of the markets in the city of Cusco, and at the same time, she also raises small animals like guinea pigs to sell to the customers who want them.  The woman has spent a lot of time in this line of work, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  It is through this work that she gets her family ahead in life.

The member is asking for this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

She is happy about the loan and promises she will comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.ru:
Sakhavat jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey drujnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 prekrasnix detey. Sakhavat 39 let. 7 let nazad on nachal zanimatsya skotovodstvom , po nachalu on razvodil ovec i potom pereprodoval ix, zatem on nachal razvodit korov i prodovat ix moloko. Sakhavat smotrit za jivotnimi a yego jena delayet yogurt, sir, kefir i t.d dlya prodaji. Ix bizness mojno nazvat semeynim. 
Seychas Sakhavat nujdayetsya v 1500 AZN chtobi kupit seno dlya korov na zimu. On xochet razvit svoy bizness v budushem i uvelichit kolichestvo skota.
 Sakhavat yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Lachin goroda kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi teritoriyami Karabakha.
texts.en:
Sakhavat lives in the Absheron region together with his close-knit family. He is married and has two wonderful children. Sakhavat is 39 years old. 

Seven years ago, he began to breed cattle. At the start, he raised sheep and then resold them, then he started to raise cows and to sell their milk. Sakhavat looks after the animals and his wife makes yogurt, cheese, kefir (a fermented milk drink), and the like, for sale. Their business can be called a family. 

Now, Sakhavat needs 1,500 AZN in order to buy hay for his cows for the winter. He wants to develop his business and in the future to increase the number of cattle. 

Sakhavat is an internally-displaced person (IDP). He is a migrant from the town of Lachin which is located within the occupied territory of Karabakh.

loans.use: to buy hay for his cows

loans.name: Rosa Adelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 57 años de edad y vive en el Municipio de Santa Cruz, Peña Blanca, vive en un unión libre con su pareja,  tiene 4 hijos. 
Los ingresos de la pareja mantienen a la familia de 6 miembros. Hace más de 8 años, Rosa puso un negocio de venta de mercadería. Ella vende de forma ambulante, ropa, sandalias, y utensilios de cocina como tazas, vasos, platos y lavamanos hechos de plástico. También trabaja por encargo los que el cliente le solicite. Empezó el negocio con el deseo de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia. Doña Rosa sacó Varios créditos anteriores para surtir su negocio y ella nota que su vida ha mejorado de manera favorable. 
La señora Rosa tiene previsto seguir aumentando sus ventas y con este crédito de L10, 000, ella va a comprar ropa, zapatos y utensilios de cocina para ampliar su inventario y surtir al negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 57, lives in the Santa Cruz municipality in Peña Blanca.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives with her life partner.  She has four children.

The couple’s income supports their family of six.  Over eight years ago Rosa set up a business of selling merchandise.  She sells clothes, sandals, kitchen utensils like cups, glasses, and plates, and plastic washbasins in an itinerant manner.  She also works by customer orders.  

She started the business with the desire to get ahead and to support her family.

Rosa has had various previous loans in order to stock her business.  She notes that her life has improved in a favorable manner.

Rosa plans to continue increasing her sales.  She will use this loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy clothes, shoes, and kitchen utensils.  She will do this in order to expand her inventory and to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sandals, clothes, and plastic products to stock her business.

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru:
Нурмахмад проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 52 года. Он живет вместе с женой. У него шестеро детей, четверо парней и двое девочек. Его старший сын живет со своей семьей, отдельно. Другой сын, студент а третий работает строителем. Трое других учатся в средней школе.

Сам Нурмахмад имеет средне - специальное образование, он шофер. Он работает таксистом. 

Нурмахмад не мог обеспечит свою большую семью занявшись одним видом деятельности. В свободное от работы время он занялся животноводством. 

Он уже более пяти лет занимается животноводством и одновременно работает таксистом. 
Он берет кредит для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья курпнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Nurmahmad lives in the Dangara region. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife. He has six children: four boys and two girls. Hi eldest son lives separately with his own family. Another son is a student and a third works in construction. The three others are in high school.

Nurmahmad himself has middle school special education: he is a driver. He works as a taxi driver. 

Nurmahmad could not provide for his large family by engaging in only one activity. In his spare time, he raised livestock.

He has more than five years of experience in animal husbandry, while also working as a taxi driver. 

He is taking a loan for the purchase of calves with the goal of increasing his herd of cattle

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Ra'nogul

texts.ru:
Раъногул родилась в 1965 году в Дангаре. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее сын студент, а дочь замужем, живет отдельно со своей семьей. 
Раъногул портниха. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Заказы берет у себя на дому. 
Раъногул уже более восьми лет занимается шитьем. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой модернизированной швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Ra'nogul was born in 1965 in the town of Dangara. She is married and has two children. Her son is a student and her daughter is married, living separately with her family. 

Ra'nogul is a dressmaker. She is engaged in sewing traditional dresses. She takes orders at her home. 

Ra'nogul has more than eight years experience in sewing. She is taking out a loan to purchase a new upgraded sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new upgraded sewing machine

loans.name: Tayari

texts.en:
Tayari, 58, is married and resides with his wife in Coast Province, Kenya. Tayari sells kitchen utensils and household goods and his wife is a businesswoman. 

Tayari is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more household food consumption and kitchen utensils to resell. By doing so, his family will be able to generate more income.

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to invest in real agents housing. This will be his sixth loan from Yehu Microfinance, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat oil, sacks of sugar, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 30 years old. He sells cosmetics to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He also operates a barber shop to generate extra income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening more outlets in different locations in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is 20 years old. He is a father of one child and resides with his wife in Samburu Coast Province, Kenya. He has been running a clothing shop for more than three years, earning approximately 200 Kenyan shillings (KES) per day. His wife is a farmer and contributes to the family's basic needs with farm produce. His child is still in his care and in school. 

In order to improve his business, Baraka is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more clothes to sell. By doing so, he will earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his child to have a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru:
Хосият родилась 1958 году в Дангаре. Она вдова. Двое ее сыновей находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. А трое дочерей занимаются шитьем. 
Хосият портниха, она занимается шитьем. В основном она шьет матрасы. Ее дочери помогают ей в ее деятельности.
Хосият более девяти лет занимается шитьем. Она научила своих дочерей шить национальные платья и матрасы. 
Хосият берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Khosiyat was born in 1958 in Dangara. She is a widow. Two of her sons are working in the Russian Federation. Her three daughters are engaged in sewing.

Khosiyat is a seamstress and she is engaged in sewing. Generally, she sews traditional mattresses. Her daughters help her in these activities. 

Khosiyat has more than nine years of experience in sewing. She taught her daughters to sew traditional dresses and mattresses. 

Khosiyat is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Bockarie B.'s Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Founded in 2002, this school is staffed with 40 able teachers and has an enrollment of 500 pupils. This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Bockarie is the leader of this group of teachers. 35-year-old Bockarie was born in Kenema. He has been in the teaching profession for 10 years now. He is married to a trader and they have one child who is attending secondary school. Bockarie has requested this loan in order to purchase house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She operates a beauty salon to support her family. Besides that, she also does farming to generate extra income. She describes her business environment to be busy and with readily available customers. 

She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of opening another outlet of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy two dryers and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy two dryers and hair oil.

loans.name: Mwanang'andu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Mwanang’andu from Msambweni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married with five children, three of whom are adults.

Mwanang’andu runs a fish selling business within a busy market area. She sells different types of fish. She has been running this business for six years. She works at the business during the afternoon hours. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuation.

Mwanang’andu has requested a loan in order to buy more stock of fish, firewood, and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a food stall. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy supplies bread for a living. He had previously acquired a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya which helped him to obtain a license for his business. He has also known how to plan for his finances because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of opening a bakery shop and opening more outlets in different locations in the future. He needs a loan of 60,000 KES to add a stock of bread.

loans.use: To add a stock of bread.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz is a person of music. He is a singer. Firuz sings the best songs. He hires out to local people for their parties as a singer. He has been busy with this kind of business for more than 15 years. He has his own singing group. Firuz is in business to help his brothers. Some years ago he bought equipment but they are old for this modern world today. He is asking for a loan to buy new equipment for developing his business and to improve the level of his service.

loans.use: To buy new equipment.

loans.name: Rakaita

texts.en:
Rakaita is 37 years old. She supports seven members of her family. She is married to Monjo. Her spouse provides additional income to the family. They have five children aged 10, 8, 6, 3 years, and 8 months.

She has been in the jewelry business for three years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). The loan will be used to purchase more jewelery for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to own a successful business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking, 26-year-old business lady. She operates a cafeteria for a living. She has been in the business for two years and has four employees. Previously, she sold clothes. 

She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to grow her business. She understands how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management.  She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy seats and tables for her cafeteria.

She dreams of expanding her business and building a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy seats  and tables for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Ma. Ligaya

texts.en:
Ma. Ligaya is a 47-year-old lady living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  She works hard to help support her husband and their six children.
She has been in the fishing business for almost seven years now. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells his catch to the people in her locality. 

Ma. Ligaya is requesting a loan worth PHP 8,000 to buy additional fishing equipment, like nets and ropes.   This can help improve her husband's catch every time he goes fishing.

In the future, Ma. Ligaya hopes to develop or improve their fishing business so that they can augment their earnings. She also wants to invest some of their income in some other profitable venture to double their sources of income, so that she can continually send her children to school for better education and learning.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment like nets and ropes.

loans.name: Mathew A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a vocational institute in the city of Kenema, in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek their first loan from Kiva lenders. They are requesting a loan of 5,900,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL), and each member will use his portion to buy or invest in something that their salaries cannot let them do. 

Mathew leads the group. He is age 40 and was born in a place call Buidu, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is a married and has 2 children who are in college. Mathew has been in the teaching profession for 14 years now. He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in a business. He will buy bricks at wholesale for selling at retail.

loans.use: to buy bricks at wholesale for selling at retail.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a teacher. She also sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. 

Since Lucy became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and making clothing for her customers in the future. She needs a loan of KES 40,000 to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a kind and focused person. He is married and raising four beautiful children, who are between the ages of 1.5 and 9 years. His wife takes care of the household and looks after the children.  In her spare time, she also helps her husband with his business. 

Mohammed operates a clothes-selling business, which he has run for the last five years.  He dreams of opening a boutique in future. To this end, Mohammed is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nafuu

texts.en:
Nafuu is a 38 year-old married woman who has two children who are both in school. To generate household income, she operates a boutique in their town’s main park. She’s been in business for two years, and thanks to the good service she offers and the good quality of the goods, she’s acquired a large number of customers who make it possible for her to have good sales and, as a result, income for her home.

She has succeeded in moving forward by means of the business providing her children with a good quality education and good economic stability, which is why she works hard to maintain it and continue to make it grow in order to make economic progress.

Because sales lately have been increasing, Nafuu is looking for a loan to buy more beauty items so as to increase the amount of product she offers her customers, thus increasing her sales. In this way she will succeed in offering better customer service and sales will increase considerably, allowing her to have better income for the home and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty items.

loans.name: Nasiru's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a Technical Vocational school in Kenema. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 4,500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Forty-five-year-old Nasiru is the leader of this group of teachers. Nasiru was born in Kenema. He is married and has 2 children who attend secondary and tertiary institutions. Nasiru has been a teacher for 10 years. He has requested this loan to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc., for the construction of a family house. 

Staff from this school, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish tasks that they would otherwise not be able to do on their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children, others can use the loan to buy furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc., for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16, 15 y 13 años de edad, los tres  estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Nuestra amiga para poder ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él hace no alcanza para cubrir los gastos, hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por 15 años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos, ella en las mañanas preparar el delicioso ceviche de pescado y camarón plato muy degustado por sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, camarón y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiar su negocio. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city that is known for a large diversity of traditional products such as the Panama hats that are famous both within and outside of the country.

It is in this place where one can meet Sra. María. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 15, and 13) who are in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

María helps her husband with the household expenses since what he earns is not enough to cover their needs. She started a business several years ago. María has a small diner in her house where she prepares delicious dishes. She works every day from 6am to 3pm. María says that her diner has been in operation for 15 years and it has always done very well because her customers enjoy the flavor of her dishes. In the mornings, she prepares delicious “ceviche” (marinated seafood) of fish and shrimp since this dish is well-liked by her customers.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, shrimp, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. María has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have been very helpful in financing her business.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward in her business and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, shrimp, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Riziki bought wheat flour, beans, and milk that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because the number of customers has increased.  Riziki now has an established clientele, and her working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason her Kiva loan will be successful.  She will be able to respond to demand and buy corn, corn husks, vegetables, and firewood at a good price. 

Riziki wants lenders to know that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says "thank you," and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy corn, corn husks, vegetables, and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 51 años. Vive en la casa que compró, hace 32 años, en la localidad de Yanamarca. Ahí conformó su familia, junto a su esposo Fidel y sus siete hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo vive con tres de ellos: Jones, Cinthia y Diana.   

Al comienzo sólo se dedicaba a la siembra de papa, olluco, cebada y habas en sus terrenos agrícolas que tienen riego, es decir están cerca del río y pueden ser regados y fertilizados con mayor facilidad. En la actualidad se sigue dedicando a está actividad, pero el ingreso económico constante que tiene es de la ganadería, ya tiene 32 años de experiencia en la crianza, posee en la actualidad cinco cerdos, dos toros y dos vacas preñadas. Por está razón quedó disminuida la producción de leche, “no puedo dejar de producir, tengo que comprar una vaca lechera para no bajar la producción, ya cuando mis vacas den cría, tendré una buena producción pues ellas duplicarán la leche”, comenta. Ahora, se concentra en ese proyecto, pues ya tiene clientes que compran la leche, a quienes no puede defraudar. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Flora invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca lechera de buena raza, para aumentar su ganando y seguir su producción de leche.
texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old.  She lives in a home she bought 32 years ago in the area of Yanamarca. There she built a family with her spouse Fidel and her seven children, of whom only three still live at home; Jones, Cinthia, y Diana.

At the beginning she only sowed potatoes, olluco (a Peruvian tuber), barley, and broad beans in her fields that she had irrigated, which is to say the ones close to the river which could be irrigated and fertilized the most easily.  Currently, she is still involved in agriculture, but her most consistent soure of income is in raising poultry, which she has 32 years of experience in keeping.  She now has five pigs, two bulls, and two pregnant cows.  For this reason, she has much less milk production, "I cannot stop producing milk, I need to buy a milk cow to not lessen my production, and when my cows give birth, then I'll have really great production, since their milk supply will greatly increase," she comments.  Now, she is concentrating on this project, since she already has customers who buy her milk and she can't let them down.

She is a member of the community bank “Corazón de Jesús” and this is her second loan with MFP.  She really likes the work that she does with the association, since she receives support from the other members who really look out for each other.  “At every meeting, we fulfill our financial obligations responsibly," she notes.

Flora will invest the asked for funds in buying a milch cow of good stock to increase her profits and maintain her milk production.

loans.use: to buy a milch cow.

loans.name: Franklin Ramiro

texts.es: Franklin vive en Quevedo donde tiene un taller de soldadura, empezó desde muy joven como auxiliar de mecánica industrial hasta que se independizo con lo cual comenzó poco a poco a incrementar sus herramientas y clientes. El trabajo lo realiza solo y cuando necesita un ayudante contrata a su primo para que le ayuda cancelándole el día de trabajo. En su taller Franklin ofrece el servicio de soldadura, creación de puertas, ventanas y hornos de asar. No tiene horario ya que cuando tiene trabajo extiende su tiempo hasta terminarlo en la fecha pactada. Con el crédito que está solicitando va a comprar hierro, una soldadora para mejorar la atención en su negocio. A futuro espera que su negocio crezca de tal manera que pueda brindar trabajo de forma  permanente.
texts.en: Franklin lives in Quevedo where he has a welding shop.  At a very young age, he began working as an industrial mechanic’s assistant and continued in this job until he became independent and gradually increased his tools and customers.  He works alone and when he needs help, he hires his cousin to help him finish the workday.  Franklin offers welding services in his shop and makes doors, windows, and rotisserie ovens.  He doesn’t have fixed hours but when he has jobs, he extends his workday in order to finish by the contracted date.  With the loan he is requesting, he will purchase iron and solder to improve customer service in his business.  In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be able to provide permanent jobs.

loans.use: to purchase iron and solder.

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es: Ana vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil donde tiene su casa propia la cual cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza para la mujer por catalogo, el negocio lo empezó hace un año y lo inicio por una amiga quien le enseño como es el manejo de los pedidos y los pagos, también le enseño como se gana más dinero comprando productos en promoción para tenerlo en stock. De momento tiene una pequeña vitrina donde expone la mercadería para la venta. Ana maneja el negocio sola visitando a sus clientes o llamándolos por teléfono por lo tanto no tiene horario definido.  Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, lápiz labial, jabones corporales. A futuro le gustaría ser directora de ventas de la marca en la cual trabaja.
texts.en: Ana lives in the Orquídeas section north of Guayaquil.  There she has her own house that has all the basic services.  She sells women’s beauty products through catalogs and has been working in this business for a year.  A friend got her into it and showed her how to manage the orders, the payments, and she also taught her how to earn more money by buying products on sale so that she could have them in stock.  Currently she has a small showcase where she puts all the merchandise that she is selling.  Ana handles the business only by visiting her customers or calling them on the phone and that is why she doesn’t have a regular schedule.  She will use the loan to buy items such as perfumes, creams, makeup, lipsticks, and body lotions.  In the future she would like to be a sales director of the brand that she sells.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, lipsticks, and body lotions

loans.name: Seleman

texts.en:
Seleman is married and the father of 6 children who still attend school. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn’t support anyone other than his family. His house has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He’s engaged in a fish selling business and with this loan he plans to buy 50 kilograms of fish for resale and cooking oil. He faces the challenge of the lack of a refrigerator, since he narrates that his fish at times go bad, hence incurring some losses. 

In the future he hopes to open a shop and further his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old, and she lives with her life partner and four children in her own house. 

She owns a shop where she sells such basic necessities as beans, bread, eggs, and soap. She has been in this line of business for many years, and it has given her good results. Her shop is located in a strategic place, and she has many customers.  Everybody prefers her because her shop is the best supplied, she sells quality products at good prices, and above all she provides the best service. 

Saumu is a resourceful woman with a great desire to progress in life. She wants to reach success, and she will fight hard to achieve it. Recently there has been an increase in customer requests, and she needs to invest, but she does not have enough money, so she is asking Yehu Microfinance for a loan to buy basic grains, instant foods, sweets, and drinks. 

Saumu is very responsible, and she has good credit references. She is sure she will repay her due and that she will provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant foods, sweets, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Vita

texts.ru: Вита просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки летних мужских футболок. Благодаря предыдущму кредиту Вита смогла закупить больше товара и увелиичить свою прибыль. Вита говорит, что "микрокредиты помогают ей стимулировать товарооборот и закупочную деятельность", а в результате увеличивают прибыль. Это особенно актуально, т.к. Вита вдова и ее бизнес - единственный источник дохода. Вита благодарит всех, кто участвует в ее бизнесе и жизни посредством микрокредитования.
texts.en: Vita is asking for a loan to purchase men's summer t-shirts. Because of her last loan Vita was able to purchase more clothes for sale and increased her profits. Vitas says that "microcredit help her stimulate inventory turnover and purchasing activity", which results in additional profits. This is very important to her as Vita is a widow and her business is the sole source of income for the family. Vita is grateful to everybody who is participating in her business and life by contributing to the microcredit.

loans.use: to purchase men's summer t-shirts

loans.name: Rafael Hermes

texts.es: Rafael Hermes, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y tres hijos,  de los cuales unos estudian y otros le ayudan en las labores del campo. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como fumigaciones, abonos, para la asistencia del almacigo de café para su posterior siembra  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado   sembrar todo este  almacigo para poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rafael Hermes is 50 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children who are either studying or helping with the work in the fields. Rafael intends to use this loan to buy supplies for fumigation and compost so that he can maintain his coffee seedbed. The loan will also help with the eventual replanting and the cost of labor. He plans to replant his entire seedbed so that he can produce slightly more and generate better earnings. This will help him obtain a better quality of life and financial stability so that he can pay for his children’s education.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Rafael has not received any other prior loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fumigation supplies and compost for his coffee seedbed.

loans.name: Buenas Emprendedoras - 26 Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento BUENAS EMPRENDEDORAS - 26
Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Emma tiene 47 años, casada con tres hijos mayores de 25 años ya independientes, La Sra. Emma  se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se  encuentra en la zona de Tembladerani, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Emma va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de  insumos como arroz, fideo y aceite por mayor para la elaboración de sus comidas y  así ofrecer variedad platillos  y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Emma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Emma  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank “Buenas Emprendedoras” (Good Entrepreneurs) is made up for nine members, 7 of whom are women and 2 men. Emma is the president of the bank. She is 47 years old and married with three children who are already grown and over 25 years old. Emma works making and selling food in her shop in the Tembladerani neighborhood. This will be her first loan cycle. Emma will use the loan to buy ingredients like rice, noodles, and oil in bulk to make her meals and also to offer a variety of dishes to her customers and increase her income. Her reason for getting the loan is to continue improving her business. Emma will use the profits to continue buying utensils and ingredients to make her food. Emma is a very hardworking person who is happy about the opportunity that’s been offered to her and to the other communal bank members since in some cases they are the sole breadwinner in the family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Zayda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Zayda; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de sabanas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las sabanas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sabanas al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the community bank “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

The bank member's name is Zayda.  She is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  She spends her time in the sales of sheets, which she sells as a street vendor from 8:00AM until 6:00PM.  By means of this business, she helps her children get ahead, and she has a dream of having a place of her own to sell her sheets.  The bank member is asking for the loan to buy sheets in bulk.

She is very happy about the loan and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy sheets in bulk.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila; la socia tiene 60 años de edad, casada y tiene 6 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animales para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gallinas para su negoció.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the community bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.”  The bank is located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Cirila, and she is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children.  She spends her days working in the growth and care of animals like guinea pigs and hens.  She raises the animals to sell them to her customers who ask for them.  She spends a lot of time in this business which is going well thanks to the care she gives them every day.  IN this way, she helps her family get ahead.

This member is asking for a loan to buy hens for her business.

She is happy about the loan and she promises to comply with the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; la socia tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, gaseosas, aceite entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The woman is a member of the community bank “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO.”  The bank is located in the province and the department of Cusco.

Julia is 25 years old, and has a live-in partner and three children.  She spends her days minding a small grocery store.  She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, sodas, oil, and others.  This member has spent a good amount of time in her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day, being the mens with which she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy sodas for her business.

She is happy with the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sodas for her business.

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en:
Jessy is 29 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. She makes a living selling food, breakfast, and lunch in her cafe. She sells a variety of foods, such as rice and beans and flat breads. Her business is located in a nearby trading center, where she's had it for several years. 

With time, she has gained a lot of experience in the kitchen and with sales. She has a lot of customers as she prepares the most exquisite dishes in the area. People prefer her because everything is very hygienic, made with the best-quality raw materials, and affordable, and she has the fastest service. 

Jessy is a woman who loves her work and devotes herself to it day after day.  She knows that only if she puts in her best effort and motivation will she reach success. One of her biggest dreams is to expand her business to a hotel. Now that she's increased sales, she wants to take advantage of this and invest in supplies for production. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy wheat flour, sugar, beans, and other foods. Jessy is very responsible and has excellent credit references.  She is confident she will be able to repay the debt, and at the same time she has the certainty that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, beans, and other foods for her cafe.

loans.name: Everylyne

texts.en:
Everylyne is a farmer in Kitale.  She is 46 years old and married with five children, aged between 10 and 22 years. She has been in farming for eight years. Her current production includes milk, maize, and vegetables, which she sells to the local market.

Everylyne has requested a loan of KES 51,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow, for KES 41,600, and build a dairy unit, for KES 10,000. She will use the income to repay the loan and improve the living standards of her children. Her major focus is to acquire more assets for the future.

However, she laments the high costs of animal feed.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erica; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lubricantes, ella tiene una tienda donde vende aceites y lubricantes para carros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de lubricantes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lubricantes y aceites para carros.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the community bank “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which pertains to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is named Erica, she is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She spends her days in the sales of lubricants.  She has a business where she sells oils and lubricants for cars, and she works from about 8:00AM until 6:00pm.  By way of this business, she helps her children get ahead, and her dreams is to grow her business' sales of lubricants.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy lubricants and oils for cars.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and oils for cars.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is 50 years old and lives with her three children. She is a very responsible woman who would like a better future for her children. With this in mind, she works selling fish.  She buys them from fishmongers and fries them for sale. She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor, traveling to different places and cantons.  She also does farming.
