This helps her to make more profits.

Luvuno is requesting a loan so she can buy a larger quantity of fish. She would also like to purchase seeds and plant them.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu, who lives with her family, has been raising goats for sale for several years now and has much experience in this line of work. She sells in all the areas nearby and has many customers because they know that everything she sells is top quality and at affordable prices; in addition service is excellent.

Mbeyu, an enterprising woman who is willing to improve, wants to put her best effort into attaining success. She wants to make the business grow but needs investment capital which is why she’s asking YEHU microfinance for a loan to buy more goats for resale.

Mbeyu has excellent payment references and is very responsible. She assures lenders that she’ll repay the loan and at the same time give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru:
Айнуре 35 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  Айнура с 2000 года занимается откормом и перепродажей скота, ставшим основным источником дохода для ее семьи.   Вложенная сумма в 500 сом (KGS) в основание Айнурой своего хозяйства, на сегодняшний день приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.
Имея в наличии 3 дойных коров с приплодом и 25 овец,  Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение хозяйства посредством покупки земли.
texts.en:
Ainura is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Since 2000, Ainura has been engaged in the fattening and sale of cattle, which became the main source of income for her family. The deposited sum of 500 som (KGS) at the base of Ainura's farm today brings about 20,000 som (KGS) monthly from the sale of dairy and meat products. 

Having currently three dairy cows and 25 sheep, Ainura appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the sum of 65,000 som (KGS) to increase the number of her livestock. Ainura plans to use income from the loan to invest in further expansion of her household through the purchase of land.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Lidian Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidian Rocio; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas  y polos y también la socia vende productos de belleza como lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, tanto los perfumes como los productos de belleza lo vende en forma independiente, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa y los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos y también para comprar perfumes, cremas y lápiz labiales.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the community bank “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, a part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Lidian Rocio is 41 years old and partnered with four children.  She varies her daily activities with a business in clothing sales, like pants, blouses, and polo shirts and she also sells beauty products such as lip pencils, creams, and perfumes.  The perfumes as well as the beauty products she sells independently, and by means of these businesses, she is helping her children get a good start in life.  Her dream is to have a shop of her own where she can sell the clothing and beauty products.  She is asking for a loan to buy pants, blouses, sweaters, and polo shirts, and also to buy perfumes, creams, and lip pencils.

She is very happy about the loan and she promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, sweaters, and polo shirts and also to buy perfumes, beauty creams, and lip pencils.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evarista; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo como profesora. La socia solicita el préstamo, para pagar la educación de su hijo que estudia en la universidad.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the community bank “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Evarista; she is 58 years old and is a widow with 9 children.  She spends her days working as a primary school teacher.  She works each day from 8:00AM until 1:00PM, and through this work she helps her children to get ahead.  Her dream is to get better in her job as a teacher.  She is asking for this loan in order to pay for her son's education as he studies at the university.

She is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her child, who is studying at the university.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, who lives in the coastal region of Kenya known as Kaloleni, is 21 years old, single, and makes a living selling food at a busy market. She has had this business for three years, having started it when she was fresh from high school. She manages the business alone, operating during various hours, especially during the mornings, afternoons, and evenings. Sometimes her young brother goes with her during the weekends.

With this loan, Susan will buy wheat flour, sugar, firewood, and cooking oil. A focused lady who always wants to progress, she hopes to open a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vasiyat

texts.ru:
Васият родилась 1964 году в Турсунзаде. Она замужем. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. 
Васият занималась торговлей на рынке. В этой области она была год.
Васият недавно у себя дома построила аптеку. Она решила помочь своим соседям и себе в первую очередь, так как ближайшая аптека находится в другом районе. 
Васият берет кредит для приобретения лекарств и препаратов.
texts.en:
Vasiyat was born in 1964 in Tursunzade. She is married though her husband left to work in the Russian Federation. 

Vasiyat is engaged in trade in the market. She has been working in this area for a year. 

Vasiyat recently built a home pharmacy. She decided to help her neighbors and herself in the first place, since the nearest pharmacy is in a different area. 

Vasiyat is taking a loan for the purchase of drugs and medicines.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and medicines

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dorotea; la socia tiene 48 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la ganadería y  venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cebollas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Ima Sumac Suncco' community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is Dorotea.  She is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs.  She raises the animals and then sells them to customers who request them.  She also raises cattle and sells vegetables.  She has been in the business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the determination which she puts into her work every day.  This is how she provides for her family.

Dorotea is requesting this loan to buy onions for her business.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy onions for her business

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 45 años, tiene tres hijos. Vive en la casa que compró hace 20 años, en la localidad de Yanamarca.
Durante más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería. Posee extensas áreas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra diversos productos. Asimismo, posee vacas de buena calidad de las que extrae la leche que comercializa cada día. Pero desde hace 5 años, también abrió una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, verduras y bebidas de todo tipo. “Todas las tardes me dedico a cuidar mi tienda, en ese horario recibo la mayor cantidad de clientes que consumen, sobre todo las bebidas, es ahí donde obtengo muchas ganancias”, afirma.  Es por eso que quiere comprar más bebidas y abastecerse para el mes de julio, temporada de fiestas patrias en el Perú, donde existe mayor cantidad de visitas a la zona y los días no laborables los pobladores se recreen y consumen más bebidas.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno.
Aníbal invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cajas de bebidas, entre gasificadas y cervezas, para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Aníbal is 45 years old and has three children.  He lives in a house that he bought 20 years ago, in the town of Yanamarca.  

Aníbal has been farming and raising livestock for more than ten years.  He has large areas of farmland where he grows different crops.  He also owns good-quality cows whose milk he sells every day.  In addition, five years ago he opened a grocery store where he sells basic products such as rice, sugar, eggs, vegetables and all kinds of drinks.  "Every afternoon I look after my store.  This is when I receive the most customers and they mainly consume drinks.  This is where I make a lot of profits", he says.  For this reason, Aníbal would like to buy more drinks and stock up for the month of July when Peru's independence celebrations take place.  This means there are a lot of people visiting the area and on non-work days locals have fun and consume more drinks.

Aníbal is a member of the 'Corazón de Jesús' community ban and this is his fifth loan from MFP.  He really enjoys the work that he does within his community bank because he has the support of his fellow group members who look out for each other.

Aníbal will invest the money he has requested in buying several crates of drinks, both soda and beer, to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy several crates of drinks (beer and soda) for his store

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is married and has five children who are attending school. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since she is a widow, Zainabu decided to start working about 2 years ago, selling dry fish and coconuts, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home's finances. She narrates that she started with a small amount of capital given to her by her father, and since then her business has grown a little bit. Thanks to the increasing number of customers, Zainabu is looking for a loan to buy more stock of fish and coconuts in order to offer a better service to her customers. In this way she will get through, using her own assets and her business will continue to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and coconuts

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been a farmer for four years, a job she has learned from her friend and thanks to which she has succeeded in getting ahead up to now. Margaret lives with her husband and children in a rural area where agriculture is the main economic activity. She grows beans and maize, two of the most sold basic cereals of the country as they are important elements of the main diet. 

Margaret is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance as she wishes to have enough money to buy a higher quantity of beans and maize seedlings to plant, since this is the activity that allows her to provide for her family. Margaret hopes to plant many more seeds and to be able to earn more than last year. She also wants to buy manure and other basic necessities for her crops in order to improve her activity.

loans.use: to buy a higher quantity of beans and maize seedlings to plant

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 29-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has three children who are in school.

Patricia has worked as a reseller since 2008, selling household utensils to all of the customers in the market. She buys her products in a nearby town, and works by herself. Her main difficulty is currently her shortage of stock.

Patricia has requested her second loan from Yehu to buy more utensils for resale. She wants to reinvest in her business. Over the coming years, Patricia would like to open a store in the market of Tiribe. She says that, with her profits, she wants to provide for her family’s well being and education.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for resale.

loans.name: Jackeline Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jackeline Elizabeth; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi y ella se encarga de administrar, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es mejorar el negocio de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar llantas y comprar repuestos para su carro.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Juntos a Trabajar' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The member is Jackeline Elizabeth who is 28 years old, single, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her transport business.  She has a car which provides a taxi service and she is in charge of managing it.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and this is how she provides for her children.  Her dream is to improve her transport business.  She is requesting this loan to buy tires and spare parts for her car.

Jackeline Elizabeth is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for her car

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera has lived with her lifetime companion and their children in their own house for thirteen years. She owns a store where she sells basic items such as beans, bread, eggs, drinks, soap and charcoal etc. and these help her cover her household expenses. She is well-known in the area and she has many customers. She has the advantage of not having much competition around. People prefer her store because she always has quality products and excellent prices. She also gives good service.

Sera is a very hard-working woman always ready to take on any opportunity that presents itself to be successful. One of her biggest dreams is to expand her business. She needs capital that will allow her to buy a motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business.

Sera has a good credit history and she is very responsible. She knows that she can cover the debt and at the same time give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman and lives with her eight children, ages 35 to 8; two of whom are in school. She sells new and used clothing. Her business has existed for more than five years, and is well-known by many people in her neighborhood. 

Umazi is very hard-working, business-minded, intelligent, and responsible. A few years ago, she decided to start her clothing business and it is the main source of income for her family. Every day she wakes up very early to do all of the household chores, take care of her family, and then attend to her business. Many people prefer her business because Umazi is a very friendly and responsible woman, but most importantly, her customers always find what they are looking for at the best prices. Her dream is to be able to build her inventory to increase sales, and in this way, be able to increase her income and better support her family. 

Umazi is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of two lots of used clothes and to buy new clothing. Through this, she hopes she will succeed in achieving her dream of reaching a better quality of life. It is important to mention that she is very grateful to Yehu Microfinance for having previously helped her with a request similar to this one.

loans.use: to buy two lots of used clothes and to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila lives with her life partner and her children. She buys and sells food in a stall, and she has already been in this line of work for many years. In addition, they own a store where they sell essential goods such as basic grains, milk, eggs, bread, etc. She has gotten a lot of customers because everyone prefers to go to her, since everything she sells is high quality at affordable prices, and the service is unmatched. 

Priscila is a determined woman who's always fully intent on reaching a more prosperous future. Lately her business has seen a rise in demand, which is why she decided to invest in supplies in order to increase her sales. She needs working capital, so she requests a loan from Yehu Microfinance which allows her to purchase basic grains, bread, candy, etc. Priscila is a woman who's always dedicated to her work, and she's expecting to get new opportunities that allow her to repay the debt in a timely manner and also improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, bread, candy, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo vive en las Orquídeas al norte de Guayaquil. Tiene 31 años es soltero y no tiene hijos. Hace 5 años se dedica a la mecánica empezando como ayudante en un taller mecánico, fue ahí donde aprendió todo lo que sabe de arreglo de automotores conocimiento que ahora pone en práctica en su taller. A Rodolfo le gusta mucho su negocio tanto así que empieza su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Parte de los servicios que ofrece están los cambio de aceite, llantas, enderezada, pintada, baja de maquina etc., en el caso de requerirlo también acude a los lugares donde sus clientes lo soliciten para remolcar los autos. Con el préstamo va a comprar herramientas para mejorar la calidad de servicio en su taller.
texts.en: Rodolfo lives in las Orquídeas, in the north of Guayaquil.  He is 31 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He has been working as a mechanic for five years, having started out as an assistant in an auto repair shop.  This was where he learned everything he knows about fixing cars.  He now puts this knowledge into practice in his workshop.  Rodolfo really enjoys his business, so much so that he starts work at 7 in the morning and works until 8 at night.  Some of the services he provides are oil changes, tire changes, panel beating, painting, etc.  If necessary, he also travels to the places his customers require in order to tow their cars.  He will use his loan to buy tools so that he can improve the quality of service he provides in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Remmy

texts.en:
Remmy lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province. She is married and has one child. She owns a salon which she has been operating for one year now. She started the business with her savings.

She learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations and inflation, unseasonable weather and purchasing stock.

Remmy is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy more equipment for the salon business e.g., a hair dryer. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to start another business in future. Her future plan is to start other businesses to provide for the family’s other needs.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for the salon business e.g. a hair dryer.

loans.name: Balakhanum

texts.en:
Balakhanum is 43 years old. She lives in a small village in Gardabi District with her family: her husband, Elkhan, and their three children (12, 18 and 19 years old). The youngest child studies in the village school, and the elder children help their parents in the family business. The family earns their living through agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where various greens are grown. They sell greens on the local open market. Balakhanum and Elkhan also have 10 calves; they raise them and sell them after several months.

Balakhanum and Elkhan requested a credit to expand their agricultural business. They plan to purchase sheep and raise them. They will sell them after several months for a higher price. They hope to receive a good profit. With increased profit they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand sheep breeding and cattle breeding. This will positively influence the income of the family. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved. Balakhanum and Elkhan hope for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Phoibe

texts.en: Phoibe is aged 24. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan requested, she wants to add more types of clothes to her inventory for resale. The profits from the business of clothes-selling will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Makazi

texts.en:
Makazi lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province. She is married with two children. She owns a cosmetics shop and has been operating it for one and a half years now. She started the business through a contribution from her husband. Besides this business, Makazi also sells juice.

She learnt about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are finding customers, high fuel prices and transport costs.

Makazi is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to buy more braids, shampoo and other cosmetics materials. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve and boost her soft drinks business. Her future plans are to open three more cosmetics shops and to employ some assistants.

loans.use: To buy more braids, shampoo and other cosmetics materials.

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is 30 years old. She is married and lives in the small village of Khelvachauri District with her family: her husband, Roman, three children (8, 12 and 14 years old), parents-in-law and two brothers-in-law. Her husband is a truck driver, her children study in the village school and her parents-in-law are pensioners. The main activity of the family is an agricultural business. They have 1 hectare of land, where they grow vegetables and fruits. The family has bee-hives with bee colonies too. They produce honey and sell it in nearby villages. They have milking cows and produce dairy food, cheese, cards and yogurt, part of which is used by the family members and the rest is sold locally. Roman has a truck. He takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. All family members work hard during the days.

Nestan and her family requested a loan to purchase tires for the truck, because they are old and it is already risky to drive in the forest. For this reason, Roman has stopped operations. They will buy new tires.  After changing them, Roman will be able to continue transportation and sales of wood. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase tires for a truck

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras y frutas, ella lleva manzanas, naranjas, platanos, cebollas, zapallos y lechugas a lugares como Puerto Maldonado, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar manzanas, plátanos, lechugas, cebollas y zapallos al por mayor.
                                                    
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Juntos a Trabajar' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The member is Valentina.  She is 45 years old, lives with her partner and has six children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling fruit and vegetables.  She takes apples, oranges, bananas, onions, squashes and lettuces to places such as Puerto Maldonado.  Through this business, she provides for her children.  Valentina's dream is to expand and improve her fruit and veg business.  She is requesting this loan to buy apples, bananas, lettuce, onions and squashes wholesale.

Valentina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, lettuce, onions and squashes wholesale

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Trinidad; la socia tiene 50 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de leña, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante  a su familia, la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de leña al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Ima Sumac Suncco" community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is Trinidad.  She is 50 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling firewood.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is how she provides for her family.  She is a responsible person who has a great desire to continue making progress for the sake of her family.

Trinidad is requesting this loan to buy firewood wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy firewood wholesale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 35 years old. She is married with three children aged between 6 and 15 years. She sells sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. The loan requested will be used to buy more sugar and cooking oil for sale. With the profits, she will put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
UNIDAS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO ESTA INTEGRADO POR 7 MUJERES EMPRENDEORAS Y COMERCIANTES.
SUS NOMBRES SON ADELINA,ALMA,JUANA,MA DE LOS ANGELES,MARIANA,RAQUEL Y REBECA.
ADELINA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES, TIENE 45 AÑOS ES CASADA Y MADRE DE 3 HIJOS DE 9,7 Y 12 AÑOS.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE DULCES REGIONALES, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS.
ADELINA PIENSA UTILIZAR SU CREDITO, EN SURTIR MAS MERCANCIA YA QUE SE LE TERMINA MUY PRONTO,Y TIENE QUE IR A SURTIR CADA TERCER DIA HASTA EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD.
ADELINA EN UN FUTURO LE GUSTARIA TENER, UN LOCAL PARA LA VENTA DE MAYOREO DE DULCES REGIONALES DE LECHE QUEMADA Y MEMBRILLO.PARA ATENDER EL NEGOCIO JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO E HIJOS.
texts.en:
Unidas is a supportive group of Credituyo. It has 7 female members who are entrepreneurs. Their names are Adelina, Alma, Juana, Ma de los Angeles, Mariana, Raquel and Rebeca. Adelina, one of the members, is 45 years old, married and a mother of three children of 7, 9 and 12 years of age. 

She makes a living selling regional sweets with her husband, having done so for many years. Adelina plans to use her loan to stock up more merchandise because it is running out very soon. She has to stock up every third day in the center of the city. 

In the future Adelina would like to have her own locale to sell the local sweets wholesale, which include "leche quemada" and "membrillo". Here she would attend to the business with her huband and children.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Jorame

texts.en:
Jorame lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province. He is single. He owns a soft drink shop/juice vendor and has been operating it for six months now. He started the business through the advice of his friends.

He learned about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are purchasing stock, find customers and taxes.

Jorame is applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenyan shillings (KES) to pay for new stock of juices. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings to buy more equipment for the business. His future plans are to expand the business and to open a cafe.

loans.use: To pay for new stock of juices.

loans.name: Janciline

texts.en: Janciline is 37 years old. She sells clothes and has been selling clothes for a period of 14 years. With the loan requested, she  will be able to buy more clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits for putting aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 39 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in Khelvachauri District with her family: her husband, Otar and three children (12, 16 and 17 years old). All three children go to the local school. Otar is a taxi driver; he offers taxi services and has acquired extensive experience in this business. Nana runs an agricultural business. Otar helps his wife in the family business. They have 1 hectare of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown. They also have 7 bee-hives with bee colonies and produces honey and two milking cows. They milk cows twice in a day and produce dairy food: cheese, curds and yogurt. They sell harvested vegetables, fruits, honey and dairy food on the local open market. 

Nana requested a loan for her agricultural business. She plans to expand her bee-keeping and decided to purchase additional bee-hives with bee-colonies. With the increased number of bees Nana and Otar will be able to produce more honey. This will increase the sales from their business. As a result of the increased income, they will be able to improve the living conditions of their three children.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives with bee colonies

loans.name: Tanamory Salikegne Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 14 Décembre 2010, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes d’une motivation exemplaire à faire face aux difficultés de leur milieu. Elles pratiquent en majorité la restauration et le petit commerce car se trouvant dans une zone frontalière fréquentés par beaucoup de voyageurs.

Madame  khadidiatou  (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette, âgée de 52 ans, marié et mère de 02 enfants un garçon une fille cette femme est pleine d’ambition. Elle détient un restaurant depuis plus de cinq.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter du riz de l’huile et autres ingrédients allant dans la préparation des différents plats qu’elle propose à sa clientèle. Cette activité marche bien dans la zone du fait des déplacements fréquents en les deux pays limitrophes.

Avec les bénéfices que cette activité génère, elle compte aider son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This village bank was formed on December 14th, 2010.  It is made up of women of exemplary motivation when it comes to facing up to difficulties that present themselves.  They mostly work in food production and small business because they live in a border area which is visited by a lot of travelers.

Kadidiatou (sitting on the far right) is the featured borrower.  She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of two children: a son and a daughter.  This lady is full of ambition and has been running a restaurant for more than five years.

With this loan, Kadidiatou plans to buy rice, oil and other ingredients she needs to prepare the different dishes she sells to her customers.  This business does well in the area owing to the frequent trips that are made to two neighboring countries.  

With the profits she makes in this business, Kadidiatou plans to help her husband with their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other ingredients for preparing the different dishes that she sells to her customers

loans.name: Isabel Carolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel Carolina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa como casacas,pantalones,chompas y polos, la socia vende en forma independiente, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como instituciones públicas y privadas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar ropa como pantalones, chompas, polos y pantalones.
                  
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Juntos a Trabajar" community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

The member is Isabel Carolina.  She is 32 years old, single, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothing such as jackets, pants, sweaters and tops.  She sells independently.  She takes her goods to sell in different places such as public and private institutions.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm and this is how she provides for her children.  Her dream is to expand her clothing business.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothing such as pants, sweaters and tops.

Isabel Carolina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as jackets, pants, sweaters and tops

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; la socia tiene 28 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la panadería, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Ima Sumac Suncco". The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Ana, she is 28 years old and has three children. She alternates her daily work with the business of raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She raises these small animals to then sell to her customers that order from her. At the same time she makes a living working at a bakery. In this way, she is moving her family forward. 

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens for her business. She is happy for this loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you these primary school teachers from Kenema, in Eastern Sierra Leone. Founded in 1985, this school is staffed with 11 teachers and has an enrollment of 215 pupils. This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders.

Abdulai, 51 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. Abdulai was born in Jojoima village and has been in the teaching profession for 31 years. He is married to a trader and the couple has 3 children. one attending secondary school and two in college. Abdulai has requested this loan in order to purchase house building materials such as cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials such as cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc.

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Shabani, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  He has been selling second-hand clothes for six years now. He works from 9.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more second-hand stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to resell.  His dream is one day to be able to build his own house.

Shabani will share this loan with his loan group "Crane" with 23 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Alice M.'s Group

texts.en:
This group of teachers from Kenema, Eastern Sierra Leone, has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek their first loan from Kiva lenders. They are requesting a loan of 8,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group, and each member will use their portion to buy or invest in something that they cannot afford with their salaries.

Moiwa, age 52, leads the group. He was born in Bendu Two and is married to a housewife. They have 7 children – 4 in secondary school and 3 in college. Moiwa has been in the teaching profession for 37 years. He is requesting this loan to buy house building materials such as iron, corrugated zinc, rods, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron, corrugated zinc, rods, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rita; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar pollos y cuyes.
                  
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Juntos a Trabajar' community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

The member is Rita.  She is 52 years old, single, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She fattens the animals and then sells them in different markets.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm and this is how she provides for her children.  Her dream is to expand and improve her animal business.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

Rita is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefania; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar pollos, chanchos y cuyes al por mayor y también comprar alimentos para los animales.  
                
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Juntos A Trabajar". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The member is Estefania. She is 36 years old and is married with three children. The member alternates her daily work with the business of raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. She fattens and raises the animals to then travel to sell them. She works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm. Through this work, the member moves her family forward. Her dream is to expand her animal raising business. She is requesting this loan to buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs wholesale, as well as to buy animal feed. 

She is happy to have the loan and is committed to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs to sell wholesale and also to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Janeth; la socia tiene 22 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica la compra y venta de verduras, la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gallinas  para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Ima Sumac Suncco' community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is Janeth.  She is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She raises the animals and then sells them to customers who request them.  She also buys and sells vegetables.  She works as an itinerant vendor and this is how she provides for her family.

Janeth is requesting this loan to buy hens for her business.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy hens for her business

loans.name: El Faisán Group

texts.es:
El grupo el faisán lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jessy quien se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 9 años desde tomate, melón, granadilla, banano, zanahoria, naranja, ayote, apio, pepino, ayote, papa, cebolla y chilote…etc.  El crédito lo invertirá en cebolla, papa, ajo, zanahoria, remolacha y lechuga.
Las integrantes del grupo son Lourdes del Socorro quien vende perecederos desde hace 15 años y Rosa quien vende perecederos aunque en un inicio vendía ropa.
texts.en:
The 'El Faisán' (Pheasant) group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Jessy who has been selling fruit and vegetables for nine years.  She sells tomatoes, melons, passion fruit, bananas, carrots, oranges, squashes, celery, cucumbers, potatoes, onions, baby sweetcorn, etc.  She will invest her loan in buying onions, potatoes, garlic, carrots, beets and lettuce.

The other members of the group are Lourdes del Socorro, who has been selling perishable goods for 15 years, and Rosa, who sells perishables even though she started out selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes, garlic, carrots, beets and lettuce

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana is thirty-five and a Roma woman from the vulnerable ethnic minority community; she is married and has two children, fifteen and thirteen, both going to school.  They all live in a major city in central Albania within their own community living area, under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions.  It is sadly to be noted here that Roma/Balkan Egyptian children wake up very early in the mornings and go to the city’s large trash containers searching for food.

Marjana is requesting a loan for the first time to make their living conditions better, make basic renovations to their home. She sells merchandise for a living, yet the money she earns never was never enough to do extra things, but only eat very little. 

She promises KIVA lenders that she will pay the money back, because being irresponsible is not in her character.

loans.use: To renovate her tiny one-room house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a retail shop and sells to all categories of people, retail. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. She has been in this business for eight years and works seven days a week. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. 

Grace's major business challenges include defaulters and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked shop and also to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; la socia tiene 25 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas , la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Ima Sumac Suncco' community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is Yolanda.  She is 25 years old, married, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She raises the animals and then sells them to customers who request them from her.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She is a responsible person and this is how she provides for her family.

Yolanda is requesting this loan to buy hens for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy hens for her business

loans.name: Sinza E Group

texts.en:
Rahim, who is in his early 40's, is married and has two children who go to school. He has been a taxi driver for fourteen years. He works from 5:00 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rahim's 4th loan from Tujijennge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy his own secondhand taxi. Rahim has serviced his car, paid school fees and household expenses and repaid all his loans successfully. He wants a new loan to buy a bajaji (automated rickshaw). His dream is to one day be able to buy a Canter (light-duty  commercial vehicle).

Rahim will share this loan with his group "Sinza E", consisting of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy a bajaji

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 47 años. Vive en compañía de su hijo Sebastian, en la casa que heredó de sus padres, en la localidad de Huancayo. 
Tiene experiencia en el comercio desde hace 27 años. Su coraje provienen de su pequeño hijo, por quién lucha y sale adelante. “Soy lo único que tiene en la vida”, afirma. Por esa razón comenzó a vender cubrecamas, zapatillas, entradas de baño, ollas, cubiertos y demás utensilios de cocina. Comenzó en este negocio cuando era joven, ahí aprendió el oficio de vendedor. Su trabajo es rentable, pues posee clientes fijos en todo el país, pues cuenta que viaja a distintas ciudades, de donde puede obtener ingresos superiores. Confiesa que no le gusta mucho viajar, ya que es muy cansado, además tiene que dejar a su hijos solo. Pero es ahí, viajando, donde obtiene mayores ingresos. Ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para tener los productos en un buen precio y así mantener a sus clientes contentos. 

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Las líderes del centro” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues ahora podrá mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere continuar trabajando con su asociación.
Carlos invertirá este dinero en la compra de cuatro cubrecamas para satisfacer los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 47, lives with his son, Sebastian.  They live in the house he inherited from his parents in Huancayo.

He has 27 years of business experience.   His determination is because of his son, for whom he struggles and gets ahead.  “I am the only one he has in this life,” he says.  For that reason he started to sell bedspreads, slippers, bath items, pots, cutlery, and other kitchen utensils.  He started this business when he was a young man, and he learned the trade of selling.

His business is profitable, and he has fixed customers all over the country.  He says that he travels to different cities where he is able to get higher income.  He admits that he does not like to travel much because it is very tiring, and he has to leave his children alone.  However, here he is, traveling to where he can get greater income.

He now wishes to increase his working capital in order to have products at a good price.  He will keep his customers happy this way.

He belongs to the Las Líderes del Centro communal bank.  This is his first loan with MFP.  He is grateful for the support he is getting from the association.  He will now be able to improve his business.  He pledges to be punctual with his payments because he wants to continue working with his association.

Carlos will use the money to buy four bedspreads to fill his pending orders.

loans.use: to buy four bedspreads to fill his pending orders.

loans.name: Mauricio Javier

texts.es: Mauricio Javier de 43 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, casada con dos hijos, tiene por actividad económica la venta de venta de plátanos  tiempo de tener el negocio tres años, el negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, con el objetivos de mejorar los ingresos del hogar, y sacar a mis hijos adelante, en la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para compra plátanos al por mayor y al detalle.
texts.en:
Mauricio Javier is 43 years old and is from the neighborhood of Chinandega. He is married with two children and works selling plantains. He has had this business for three years. He began this business with his own funds, with the objective of improving his household earnings and moving his children forward. 

He is currently requesting this loan to buy plantains wholesale and retail.

loans.use: to buy plantains wholesale and retail

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganadería, la socia tiene vacas las cuales cría para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a la ganadería siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de un pequeño torete.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Ima Sumac Suncco' community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is Dominga.  She is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her cattle business.  She has cows which she raises and then sells to customers who request them from her.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is how she provides for her family.

Dominga is requesting a loan to buy a young bull.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es: Claudia Elena de  34 años de edad, casado del municipio de Chinandega con dos hijos tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, tiempo de tener el negocio 6 años, el cual lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante y en el domicilio, Claudia inicio con esta herramienta de trabajo para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, y sacar adelante a sus hijos, en la actualidad Claudia está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en mercadería y satisfacer la demanda de sus cliente como: pantalones de vestir de hombre y mujer, jeans, camisas de vestir, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa de niño, cobertores, edredones entre otros.
texts.en: Claudia Elena is 34 years old, married, and lives in the town of Chinandega together with her two children.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for six years.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and also sells from home.  Claudia started this business so that she could help with her household expenses and provide for her children.  She is currently requesting a loan to invest in merchandise so that she can meet her customers' demand.  She will buy men's and women's dress pants, jeans, dress shirts, t-shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, bedspreads, comforters, etc.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's dress pants, jeans, dress shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, bedspreads, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is widowed with no children, but she takes care of her brother's children. 

She has a business selling local brew and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings to buy more sorghum, millet and cassava flour for making local brew. She generates additional income through selling firewood. She sells to all categories of people, but only retail, and works six days a week. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She would like to become a supplier and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, where the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Her major monthly expenses includes rent and school fees for her brother's children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, millet and cassava flour

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nicolasa; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,  a la vez la socia se dedica a la ganadería y  venta de hortalizas como zanahorias,cebollas,zapallo entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Ima Sumac Suncco' community bank which is located in Cusco province and department.

The member is 55-year-old Nicolasa who divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs.  She raises these animals and then sells them to customers who request them from her.  She is also in the cattle business and sells vegetables such as carrots, onions, squashes, etc.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  This is how she provides for her family.

Nicolasa is requesting a loan to buy carrots wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots wholesale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  is a single mother of eight children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her late sister's two daughters. She has a business of selling second-hand clothes and sells to all categories of people, retail.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Grace has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this clothing business she also generates additional income through poultry farming and pig-rearing. Her monthly expenses include thieves and seasonality.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a stable for their animals

loans.name: America Del Rocio

texts.es: América tiene 35 años vive en Isla Trinitaria, es madre de 4 niños quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector. En su casa América tiene una tienda surtida de abarrotes donde vende arroz, azúcar, víveres, detergentes, granos, productos del hogar. Ella heredo la tienda de parte de sus padres quienes desde temprana edad le enseñaron el trabajo por lo cual siempre le ha gustado. A partir de esto siempre le a gustado el negocio sobre todo porque tiene control de su tiempo para dedicárselos a sus hijos. El negocio lo maneja ella sola sin ayuda ya que aun no le genera el dinero suficiente para contratar un ayudante, trabaja todo el día en el ya que prefiere en lo posible no cerrar, esto lo hace ya que podría perder un cliente potencial en ese lapso de tiempo y al estar empezando no daría un buen servicio. Con el préstamo que solicita va a comprar productos para surtir su negocio llamando la atención y por ende obtener mayor clientela. A futuro a América le gustaría tener un negocio más grande con un casa en la que cuente con todos las comodidades.
texts.en:
América is 35 years old and lives in Isla Trinitaria; she is the mother of four children, who study at the public school in her area.  In her home, América has a grocery store stocked with provisions where she sells rice, sugar, other staple goods, detergents, grains, and household products.  She inherited the store from her parents who taught her from a young age to do this work which she has always enjoyed.  Apart from this, she has always liked this work because she has control over her time and is also able to devote herself to the care of her children.

This business is something that she works at alone, without help, because it doesn't generate enough income to be able to afford another employee.  She works throughout the day there, since she prefers as much as possible not to close, since she could lose a potential customer during the time she is not open and that wouldn't be starting out with good service.  With the loan she is asking for, she will buy products to restock her business, gain people's attention, and result in a greater customer base.  In the future, América would like to have a larger business and a house that has all the amenities.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, food staples, detergents, grains, and other household items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She sells produce in an open-air market, which she has been doing for three years. She started the business through her own savings.

Elizabeth learned about Milango through a friend, with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenge she is facing is price fluctuation and inflation.

Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy bananas for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to buy fruit and other types of groceries that she does not have. Her plan for the future is to expand and build her own business stalls.

loans.use: To buy bananas for sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, who is single, lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province. He owns a video library which he has been operating for six months. He started the business through a loan from his parent.

Alex learned about Milango through an employee. His aim is to access credit to improve his business operations. Alex is applying for a loan of 26,300 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy more equipment such as videos and TVs for display and additional stock of video CDs. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings to start another business. Alex's business challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. His future plans are to open five more video library shops.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and stock

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin, 22 years old, is the father of one child, aged one and half years. He has operated a business selling shoes for the past two years. Celestin wants to use this loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the shoe business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari lives in the Likoni area of Coast province. He is single. He owns a retail shop, which he has been operating for one year now. He started the business through his own meager savings.

He learned about Milango through friends, with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, seasonal weather, taxes, high transport cost and fuel.

Omari is applying for a loan of 36,700 Kenya shillings to buy additional retail stock, such as flour, salt, sugar, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to open another retail shop. His future plans are to expand the business by opening another retail shop and to employ people in his business.

loans.use: To buy additional retail stock, such as flour, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 32 años, su pareja es Lidia, con quien tiene dos hijos; Nilver de 8 y Vanesa de 5 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shimashiro (selva central).
Él lleva 2 años dedicándose a la agricultura como principal fuente de sustento para su familia. Cuenta con ocho cuadras de terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó, pero solo trabaja en cuatro de ellas. Produce café, plátanos, yuca y kión. “Tengo más café que los otros productos, es más tedioso su cultivo, pero las ganancias son buenas”, dice. Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de personal para atender con rapidez y a tiempo sus cultivos, por eso, para esta última cosecha tuvo que contratar personal y así cumplir con sus ventas. Toda su producción la ofrece en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ahí cuenta con compradores fieles.

Este es el segundo crédito que recibe de MFP. Da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Shirokis”, un grupo de socios muy entusiastas.
Con el dinero de este préstamo pagará al personal que contratará para la limpieza de su cafetal y para sembrar un poco de kión en los espacios vacíos de sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old.  His partner's name is Lidia and the couple have two children: 8-year-old Nilver and 5-year-old Vanesa.  They all live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shimashiro (in the central jungle).

Luis has been farming for two years.  It is the main way he provides for his family.  He has eight 'cuadras' (just under fourteen and a half acres) of farmland that the community gave him but he only works on four of them.  He produces coffee, bananas, cassava and ginger.  "I have more coffee than the other crops.  It is more boring to grow but the profits are good", he says.  One of the main difficulties he faces is a lack of workers to deal with his crops quickly.  Last harvest time he had to hire people in order to be able to fulfill his sales.  He sells all of his crops in the wholesale market in the city where he has loyal customers.

This is Luis' second loan from MFP.  He gives his word that he will make his monthly repayments on time.  He belongs to 'Los Shirokis' community bank which is a group with very enthusiastic members.  

Luis will use the money from this loan to pay the laborers he will hire to weed his coffee plantations and sow a little ginger in the empty spaces on his land.

loans.use: to pay laborers who will help to weed his farmland

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 53 años. Desde hace 15 años vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, ubicada en la localidad de Tambo Paccha. Ahí conformó su familia, junto a su esposa Elena y sus seis hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo vive con cuatro de ellos. 

Desde las primera hora del día se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, comenta que es muy cansado tener que levantarse tan temprano, pero le resulta satisfactorio, en la temporada de cosecha, pues tiene la seguridad de que podrá obtener buenos resultados en la venta de sus alimentos. “Si no logro limpiar, fertilizar y mantener mis sembríos lejos de plagas, puedo tener una buena cosecha”, afirma. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad más cercana, pues le resulta más fácil trasladarse hasta ese lugar, ya que su pueblo queda a dos horas de la ciudad de la otra ciudad. Aprovecha su trabajo en el campo para criar animales, tiene 22 ovejas y 2 vacas, de estas últimas extrae la leche que producen para su consumo, mientras que las ovejas las comercializa a los ganaderos de la zona, obteniendo de esa manera un ingreso extra.  

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Productores” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Durante todos estos años logró obtener grandes beneficios, como mejorar su producción de leche y la siembra, que lograron que aumente sus ganancias. Por ese motivo promete ser puntual con el pago de  sus cuotas.
Aníbal invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 40 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para distribuir en sus cultivos de habas.
texts.en:
Aníbal is 53 years old.  For the past 15 years, he has lived in the home he inherited from his parents, located in Tambo Paccha.  There he built a family with his wife Elena and their six children, of whom just four still live at home.

From the early hours of the day he directs himself to his agricultural fields; he remarks that he is very tired from having to get up so early, but it has served him well in the harvest time.  He feels secure in being able to obtain good results from the sales of his food products.  "If I don't succeed in cleaning, fertilizing, and maintaining my plantings free of infestations, I can't have a good harvest," he says.  He sells his products in the nearest city, because it's easiest for him to move them to that location, since his town is about two hours from one city to the other city.  He makes the most of his work in the countryside by raising animals.  He has 22 sheep and two cows, from the latter two he gets the milk that they produce for his own consumption, while the sheep are sold to the ranchers in the area by way of obtaining another source of income.

He is a member of the community support group “Productores” and this is his fifth credit with MFP.  In all these years he has succeeded in obtaining great benefits from his business, like increasing his milk production and plantings, which resulted in an increase in his profits.  For this reason, he promises to be able to make punctual payments on his loan.

Aníbal will invest the money from his loan in buying 40 sacks of natural fertilizers to use on his broad bean fields.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Gelgi, sigue trabajando en su costura, haciendo uniformes y una variedad de estilos en costura, unos por encargos y otros para vender gracias a esto ha cubierto sus gastos, su hija menor estudia, hoy en día, está acompañada teniendo apoyo moral y económico siendo de oficio ingeniero topógrafo.
Gelgi ha venido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda con préstamos en Afodenic, el cual ha avanzado en corto tiempo. Con este nuevo financiamiento comenzara la construcción de un nuevo cuarto en la parte de atrás, con el fin de tener mejor privacidad y comodidad para su familia. Materiales a comprar: quince laminas de zinc, quince láminas de playcen, dieciséis perlines, golosos, para comenzar hacer el cuarto.
texts.en:
Gelgi continues working in her sewing business, making uniforms and a variety of other styles of clothing.  She makes some items to fill orders and others to sell.  Thanks to this work, she has been able to cover her expenses and her youngest daughter is in school.  Gelgi is currently living with a partner.  She has moral and financial support as her partner is a surveyor.

Gelgi has been making improvements to her home through loans from Afodenic and the work has advanced over a short period of time.  With this new loan, she will build a new room out the back of her house so that she can provide her family with better privacy and comfort.  She will buy the following materials: 15 sheets of metal, 15 sheets of Plycem (fiber cement), 16 beams and bolts, in order to start building her room.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, beams, bolts and sheets of Plycem

loans.name: Halfani

texts.en:
Halfani lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province. He is married and has three children. He owns a carpentry workshop, which he has been operating for ten years now. He started the business through his little savings.

He learned about Milango through friends, with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is purchasing stock.

Halfani is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy another laser machine, timber, nails and other equipment for the workshop. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to repair the broken machines and service them. His future plans are to expand the business to sell outside his country and to establish branches in other countries.

loans.use: To buy another laser machine, timber, nails and other equipment.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She has four children. Hellen owns a tailoring shop which she has been operating for ten years.

Hellen learned about Milango through a friend. Her aim is to access credit to improve her business operations. Hellen is applying for a loan of 21,248 KES (Kenya shillings) to expand the business by buying materials to supply school uniforms. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her personal and family use. Hellen's challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and finding customers. Her plans for the future are to buy more sewing machines and employ more human resources.

loans.use: To buy materials to supply school uniforms

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. Mueni owns a green grocer which she has been operating for seven years.

Mueni learned about Milango through a friend. Her aim is to access credit to improve her business operations. Mueni is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES (Kenya shillings) to boost her business by buying tomatoes, onions and vegetables for wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. Mueni's challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transport costs and seasonal weather. Her plans for the future are to buy land and to build a rental house.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions and vegetables for wholesale.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is married, with six children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling passion fruit and oranges and has been in this business for 10 years. Angella has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of passion fruit and oranges. Besides this fruit business, she generates additional income through selling local brew and works from her home. 

Her major business challenges include thieves, defaulters and seasonality. Angella hopes to see her business grow bigger so that she starts selling wholesale only. She also hopes to educate her children up to university. Angella resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include electricity, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruit and oranges

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 30 años, su pareja es Juan Carlos, con quien tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 y 5 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia, la que construyeron en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shimashiro (selva central).

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, sabe que las tierras de su zona son fértiles y adecuadas para la producción de los diferentes productos. Lleva como 8 años en esta actividad y comenta que le agrada el trabajo del campo, porque dispone de sus horarios y por el contacto con la naturaleza.
Posee 12 cuadras o parcelas de terrenos donde cultiva café, plátano y yucas. Acaba de terminar de cosechar los granos de café, en junio, de los que obtuvo buenas ganancias, que ahora volverá a invertir en bolsas de abono. Entre sus planes más próximos están de iniciar una siembra de kiones, para ello necesitará personal operario, semillas y bolsas de abono.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Agradece la confianza en el primer crédito y afirma su compromiso de pagar con puntualidad en esta ocasión. Se siente a gusto trabajando en su banco comunal “Los Shirokis”, porque sus socios son vecinos y familiares.
Invertirá este dinero en el pago del personal operario para la limpieza de sus cultivos de café y para la siembra de kiones. Pagará 30 soles por día a cada uno.
texts.en:
Luz is 30 years old.  Her partner is Juan Carlos and the couple have three children who are 11, 8 and 5 years old.  They all live in their own home which they built in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shimashiro (in the central jungle).

Luz is a farmer.  She knows that the land in her area is fertile and suitable for growing different crops.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she says that she likes farm work because she is in charge of her own work hours and she is in touch with nature.

Luz owns 12 'cuadras' (about twenty-one and a half acres) of land where she grows coffee, bananas and cassava.  She just finished harvesting her coffee beans in June and made good profits that she will now invest in buying bags of fertilizer.  Her plans for the immediate future are to sow a crop of ginger plants.  In order to achieve this, she will need to hire laborers and buy seeds and bags of fertilizer.

This is Luz's second loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the trust that was placed in her with her first loan and she confirms that she will make her repayments on time again with this loan.  She feels happy working with her community bank ('Los Shirokis') because the members are neighbors and family members.

Luz will invest this loan in paying laborers to weed her coffee crops and sow ginger.  She will pay each one 30 soles a day.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed her land

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra, la socia tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
