Emelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Emelyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Emelyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old. She is married and has six children.
Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as snack foods, sardines, cooking oil, detergent, and other grocery products to sell.
Rosalinda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and she also earns income from fishing.
Rosalinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as snack foods, sardines, cooking oil, detergent, and other grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Leonedes

texts.en:
Leonedes is a 53-year-old resident of Riverside, Bonifacio. She provides for the needs of her 3 children from the little amount of 6,000 PHP that she gains monthly from her own piggery business, a business she has been running for 18 years as an aid to the income gained by her husband. 

Leonedes has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She is applying for a loan of 6,700 PHP from GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Leonedes wants to one day make expansions to her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 50 years old. She is married and has four children.
Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice and feed retail business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice and feed to sell.
Joy has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice and feed retail business for 25 years and also earns income from raising pigs.
Joy aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice and feed to sell.

loans.name: Magno Dioulacolon Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Magno a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il compte 27 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les femmes qui pratiquent toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Diènabou  (debout à l’extrême droit avec la main droite levée)  est l’emprunteuse vedette. Agée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois filles. Elle est vendeuse de glace, de jus de bissap, de crème glacée à  base de pin de singe. Ces produits elle les achète dans les villages environnants ou lors des «loumas»  avant la transformation pour la revente.

Elle se procure ces produits en vague comme suit : bissap à 6 000 FCFA le sac, un sac de sucre à 30 000 FCFA et un sac de 50 kilogramme de pin de singe à 5 000 FCFA.

En plus d’aider son mari dans le paiement de facture d’électricité, les bénéfices qu’elle tire de ces activités lui permettent de mieux aider ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The Magno Banc Villageois was established on December 14, 2010, on the occasion of the launch of the stated banc villageois [lending group]. It consists of 27 women who live in the same village. The women share an absolute solidarity, all of them taking part in small businesses.

Mrs. Diènabou (standing at the far right with her right hand raised) is the starring borrower. At 46 years old, she is married and the mother of five children, three of whom are girls. She sells ice, hibiscus juice, and pain de singe- [baobab fruit] based ice cream. She purchases these goods in the surrounding villages or during markets before modifying them for resale.

She buys these goods in waves, as follows: hibiscus flowers for 6,000 CFA francs per sack, a sack of sugar for 30,000 CFA francs, and a 50kg sack of pain de singe [baobab fruit] for 5,000 CFA francs.

In addition to helping her husband in the payment of the electricity bill, the profits that Mrs Diènabou recieves from her business will allow her to better help her children with their education.

loans.use: To purchase hibiscus flowers for 6,000 CFA francs per sack, one sack of sugar for 30,000 CFA francs, and one 50kg sack of pain de singe [baobab fruit] for 5,000 CFA francs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 23 años, su pareja es Javier, con quien tiene tres hijos de 7, 6 y 3 años. Esta joven familia vive en una casa rústica, pero propia, que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y se ubica en la comunidad nativa Santa Teresa, Pichanaki (selva central).

A pesar de tener tres hijos a quienes cuidar, se dedica con ahínco a las actividades agrícolas. Gracias a sus padres y suegros ahora posee ocho lotes de terrenos donde produce café, plátanos, achiote y yucas. “Cultivo café en mayor cantidad, tengo como tres cuadras en producción”, menciona orgullosa. Desde los 15 años ya sabía cómo funcionaba el negocio de sus padres, por eso no fue tan difícil hacerse cargo de sus propios cultivos, al lado de Javier. Por la extensión de sus terrenos, a veces ellos dos no se abastecen para limpiar los cultivos, por esa razón contratan personal operario para agilizar las labores. Esta mujer siente que recién está empezando y más adelante quiere mejorar su producción de achiote, ya que sus precios también son favorables.

Este es el segundo crédito que recibe de MFP. Agradece el apoyo en la primera ocasión y de la misma manera menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Ompicres” es el nombre de su banco comunal y le agrada compartir experiencias en común con sus socios.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en el pago de los jornaleros a quienes contratará para la limpieza y para el esparcimiento de fertilizantes en su cafetal.
texts.en:
Elsa is 23 years old. Her husband's name is Javier and they have three children, ages 7, 6 and 3. The young family lives in a small country house they built themselves in the community of Santa Teresa, Pichanaki, in the central forest. 

Despite having to take care of three young children, Elsa is dedicated to farming. Thanks to her parents and in-laws she owns eight plots of land, where she grows coffee, bananas, annatto and yuca. She mentions proudly that she harvests especially large quantities of coffee. Elsa's parents also worked in agriculture, so she had fifteen years of experience before cultivating her own crops with Javier.  

Since their farm has grown over time, Elsa and Javier are often unable to manage the harvest on their own so they hire temporary farm laborers to speed up the work. Elsa is hoping to hire more help soon, because it is time to harvest her annatto crop and the market prices are high. This is her second loan from MFP. She appreciated what the first loan allowed her to do and is committed to making her monthly payments on time. Her community bank is called "Los Ompicres" and Elsa is grateful for the company of its members. She will use the loan funds to pay day laborers to maintain and apply fertilizer to her coffee plantation.

loans.use: To pay the day laborers working on her farm.

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is 47 years old. She is married and has five children.
Lowela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.
Lowela has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns income from fishing.
Lowela aspires to save money to expand her business and to finish the education of one of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 46 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell.

Margie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail for three years and also earns income from farming sugarcane, coconut wine retail, and food vending.

Margie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
For over four years in Mantik, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Myla, a 33-year-old separated, mother of six children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Myla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 35 years old and married with three children.

Leonor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dry goods retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Leonor has borrowed and paid for 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dry goods retail for six years and also earns an income from baking.

Leonor aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy livestock to raise.

Lolita has been raising livestock for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy livestock to raise.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

Melanie has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell on her food stall.

Melanie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 37 years old and married with two children.

Nerissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, sardines, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Nerissa has borrowed and paid for four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years.

Nerissa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 59 years old and married with five children. She lives in Migcawanay, Tangub City. Angelita has a stall in the public market of her town, where she displays and sells her vegetable products like eggplant, amplaya, cabbage and others for a living. Angelita had been in this business for about 20 years. Every month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of activity. 

Angelita is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan to purchase additional vegetables for sale. Angelita joined GDMPC in the year 2008. Angelita's plan is that in the future she can save from her profits to renovate her house to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 37 years old and married with four children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Emma has borrowed and paid for 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old and a widow with nine children. With five children in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Imelda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.. 

In the future Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So, 67, is married with five single children. She became a widowed woman a few years ago. Now she lives with all of her children in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Her main business is farming, from which she generates the main income of family while her daughter is involved in a hog-raising business to support their needs. So has been a farmer for more than 12 years and she earns around KHR 8,000 per day. 

At present, she requested a credit of KHR 1,000,000 for both of the family's businesses. She will purchase pig feed and rent a tractor to till the land. This is her first loan from HKL and she wishes to have another loan from lenders to further improve her business as well as her family after she pays this loan off successfully.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and to rent a tractor to till the land.

loans.name: Dary's Group

texts.en:
A resident of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Dary is married and has five children. She has three daughters and two sons, all of whom are still dependent on her, and help her in the rice field. Dary has been farming rice on four-hectares of farmland for 11 years. Her husband works as a carpenter in a local area to earn extra income. They can earn about KHR 23,600 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Dary’s group consists of two members. She and the other member have been with VisionFund for six cycles and successfully paid back the past loans which have helped them achieve a better standard of living. Dary is leading this group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each from VisionFund. 

As the group leader, she is planning to use her portion to buy fertilizers and plow her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make her family's status better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and plow her farmland.

loans.name: Genny

texts.en:
Genny is 48 years old and married with six children.

Genny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Genny has borrowed and paid for 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years.

Genny aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 57 years old and married with six children.

Antonietta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Antonietta has borrowed and paid for 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Antonietta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fedela

texts.en:
Fedela works hard to support four children. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Fedela requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Fedela is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Vecinta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Vecinta works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits. Vecinta is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her ambulant vegetable vending business.

Vecinta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.en:
Ubaldo, age 59, owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Ubaldo has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Ubaldo has one child and lives in the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin Misamis Occidental. 

In 2010, Ubaldo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Ubaldo is requesting his first loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle so it gives better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle so it gives better service.

loans.name: Sophai's Group

texts.en:
Sophai is a 34-year-old married woman from Sangke district in Battambang province of Cambodia. She has one dependent daughter who is still in school. To support the family, she has been working on a one-hectare rice field for five years. In the past year, the rice has grown improperly due to lack of water, so her crop yield is low which remains the main problem for her family. 

In a group with four other members, Sophai is the leader. She received five loans from VisionFund consecutively and paid back all the loans, which have helped her to keep her daughter in school and maintain her household, with success. Now she is applying again for her sixth loan cycle for an amount of 1,400,000 KHR, the same amount as all her group members. She will use this portion to buy fertilizers and pay the costs of plowing. She expects this loan will improve her family’s conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay the costs of plowing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and married with seven children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Victoria has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 59 years old and has seven children. Tessie is married and has one child who is in school.

Tessie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She raises livestock. Tessie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Tessie has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Tessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 51 years old and married with seven children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid for 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from ready-to-wear retail.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is from Mantik, Tangub City. She is 63 years old. Rosita is married and has two children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling shellfish. She has been in her business for 10 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Rosita joined GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 which will be used to buy additional shellfish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 19 años, su pareja es Roger, con quien tiene dos hijos; Diana de 4 años y Jairo de 2 años. Ellos habitan en una casa rústica que Luz y Roger construyeron hace 3 años. Su vivienda se ubica en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shimashiro (selva central).

A pesar de su edad, Luz es una madre luchadora, se dedica a la agricultura. Todos los días se dirige a sus terrenos para realizar distintas actividades; como la limpieza, el esparcimiento de abono y fertilizantes, el cuidado de los insectos, la poda, la cosecha, etc. “El trabajo en el campo es muy cansado, por eso a veces contratamos personal”, menciona. La comunidad le otorgó dos parcelas de terrenos, en una produce café y en la otra, piñas. Luz acaba de cosechar café, por eso sus terrenos necesitan de cuidados y fertilizantes para empezar a producir, por eso no duda en levantarse muy temprano para atender a su familia y luego partir hacia sus cultivos que se encuentran a media hora de su comunidad. Por ahora espera que sus piñas crezcan un poco más para iniciar con las primeras cosechas.

Esta es la primera vez que Luz recibe un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual. Ella forma parte del banco comunal “Los Shirokis” y confía que en grupo el trabajo será más llevadero.
Invertirá todo el dinero que solicita en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes, cuyo precio es de 125 soles por saco.
texts.en:
Luz is 19 years old.  Her partner is Roger and the couple have two children: 4-year-old Diana and 2-year-old Jairo.  They live in a house made from rustic materials that Luz and Roger built three years ago.  The house is located in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shimashiro (in the central Peruvian jungle).

In spite of her age, Luz is a tenacious mother whose business is farming.  Every day she heads to her land to carry out different tasks such as weeding, spreading manure and fertilizers, protecting her crops from insects, pruning, harvesting, etc.  "Farm work is very tiring and so sometimes we hire workers", she says.  The community gave her two plots of land.  She grows coffee on one plot and pineapples on the other.  Luz has just harvested her coffee and so her land needs to be cared for and fertilized before it starts producing again.  Luz doesn't hesitate to get up very early to see to her family and then go out to her crops which are half an hour from her community.  Right now, she is hoping that her pineapples will grow a little more so that she can start her first harvests.

This is the first time that Luz has received a loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual.  She is a member of 'Los Shirokis' community bank and she believes that the group work will be more bearable.

Luz will invest all the money she is requesting in buying bags of fertilizer at 125 soles a bag.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 14 Décembre 2010, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes d’une motivation exemplaire à faire face aux difficultés de leur milieu. Elles pratiquent en majorité la restauration et le petit commerce car se trouvant dans une zone frontalière fréquentés par beaucoup de voyageurs.

  Madame Awa, restauratrice depuis plus d’une quinzaine d’années est veuve, âgée de 55 ans  et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Avec l’aide une bonne elle prépare des repas qu’elle vend aux différents voyageurs  en partance pour la sous région.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz à 14 500 FCFA le sac, un bidon d’huile de 20 litre et assaisonnement.

Les bénéfices qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants inscris à l’école privée.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was set up on 14th December 2010 and is made up of women with exemplary motivation to cope with the difficulties of their environment. The majority of them are in the restauration and small business trade as they are in an area near the border which is frequented by a lot of travelers. 

Awa, who has been in the restauration trade for more than 15 years, is a widow, who is 55 years old and mother to three children, including one girl. With the help of a maid she prepares means that she sells to the various travelers who are setting off for the sub-region. 

With this new loan she is planning to buy three sacks of rice at 14,500FCFA per sack, a 20 liter container of oil and seasonings.

The profits she makes from this business allow her to pay for the schooling costs of her children who are registered in a private school.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice at 14,500FCFA per sack, a 20 liter container of oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Mary Jane is aware that by using the solar lamp she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet works hard to support 4 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nanet requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Nanet is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Evelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola tiene 54 años, su pareja es César, con quien tiene doce hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos (los de 17 y 15 años). Esta familia habita en su casa propia, la que está construida en un terreno que la comunidad le otorgó.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeña y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con seis parcelas de terreno que la comunidad le otorgó por tener tantos años viviendo en la zona. Produce cuatro cuadras de café, en una parcela cultiva cacao, en otra achiote y en otra cítricos como naranjas y mandarinas. Menciona que el año pasado la enfermedad afectó sus frutos cítricos, por eso no obtuvo buenas ganancias. Pero siempre el café, cacao y achiote la salvan por sus precios rentables. Ella no se rinde fácilmente y continuará cultivando los cítricos, para ello invertirá en más bolsas de abono. Ahora también piensa cultivar kión, como meta más cercana, pues menciona que los precios de venta son rentables.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con responsabilidad las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Shirokis”, del que se siente entusiasta y dispuesta a participar de las actividades. 
De este préstamo, invertirá 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono para fertilizar sus sembríos de café; los 500 soles restantes los destinará al pago de los jornaleros que limpiarán un terreno para iniciar con la siembra de kión.
texts.en:
Lola is 54 years old.  Her partner is César.  The couple have twelve children but currently only live with two of them (their 17 year old and their 15 year old).  The family live in their own home which is built on a plot of land that the community gave them.

Lola has been farming since she was young and it is through this business that she supports her family.  She currently has six plots of land which the community gave her for having lived in the area for so many years.  She grows coffee over four 'cuadras' of land (just over 7 acres), cacao on another (1.8 acres), annatto on another and citrus fruits such as oranges and mandarins on another.  She says that last year a disease affected her citrus fruits and so she didn't make good profits.  However, her coffee, cacao and annatto always save her because they are profitable.  Lola does not give up easily and she will continue growing her citrus fruits.  She will invest in buying more bags of fertilizer for them.  Right now, she is planning to grow ginger as her immediate goal because she says that it is profitable.

This is Lola's second loan from MFP and so she gives her word that she will make her repayments responsibly.  She belongs to 'Los Shirokis' community bank and she feels enthusiastic and ready to take part in their activities.

Lola will invest 1,500 soles of this loan in buying bags of fertilizer so that she can fertilize her coffee crops.  The will use the 500 soles remaining to pay the laborers who will weed her land so that she can start growing ginger.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay laborers who will work on her land

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián tiene 34 años, junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Teresa, Pichanaki (selva central).
Desde los 14 años se dedica a la agricultura, por ayudar a sus padres aprendió como producir sus tierras. Actualmente cuenta con cinco parcelas donde cultiva café y achiote. “A los 22 años empecé a plantar café, desde entonces nos va bien con la agricultura”, dice. El motor que lo impulsa a seguir es ver a sus hijos bien educados y con mejores proyectos de vida, por ello se esfuerza todos los días en el campo. Su esposa lo apoya incondicionalmente en la limpieza de su cafetal. “El café requiere más cuidados, porque la mala yerba siempre crece y cada mes tenemos que limpiar, sino no hay buena producción”. Una de sus metas es ampliar su producción con la adquisición de más terrenos de cultivos e incursionar en la producción de otros productos como cítricos.

Este es el segundo crédito que recibe de MFP. Como en el préstamo anterior manifiesta que será puntual en el pago. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal “Los Ompicres”, porque sus socios realizan reuniones y todos participan activamente.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá comprar bolsas de fertilizantes para su cafetal. Además pagará a los jornaleros quienes le apoyarán en la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fabián is 34.  He and his partner have three children who are 12, 10 and 8 years old.  They live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Santa Teresa, Pichanaki (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Fabián has been farming since he was 14 years old.  He learned how to grow crops by helping his parents.  He currently has five plots of land where he grows coffee and annatto.  "I started planting coffee when I was 22.  Since then our farming has gone well", he says.  The motivation that drives him to continue working is seeing his children become well educated and enjoying better possibilities in life.  For this reason, he works hard every day in the fields.  His wife supports him unconditionally in weeding their coffee plantation.  "Coffee needs more care because weeds always grow and every month we have to weed.  If we don't, we don't get good yields".  One of Fabián's goals is to expand his production by acquiring more farm land and starting to grow other products such as citrus fruits.

This is Fabián's second loan from MFP.  He pledges to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loan.  He feels happy with his community bank "Los Ompicres" because the members have meetings and everybody takes an active part in them.

With this money, Fabián will buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee plantation.  He will also pay laborers who will support him in weeding among his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay the laborers who will work on his land

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 54 años, está casado con Andelina, con quien tiene ocho hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con tres de ellos, los de 15, 9 y 8 años. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Teresa (selva central).

Hace 15 años que se dedica a la agricultura en terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó. Los años no han pasado en vano, ya que trabaja la tierra con inteligencia. Posee cuatro parcelas donde produce café, achiote y plátano. “El café es más rentable, porque las ganancias son buenas en una época del año, pero con los otros productos puedo solventar mis gastos diarios”, menciona.
Por esa razón cuida a sus cultivos por igual, con el mismo esmero y dedicación. De esta manera logró mantener a sus hijos mayores y lo continúa haciendo con los más pequeños. Ahora piensa cultivar más plátano en un pequeño espacio entre el café, así aumentará su producción, mientras tanto se esfuerza en el cuidado de los otros productos.

Este es el segundo crédito que recibe de MFP. Agradece el apoyo por confiar en él y menciona que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Ompicres”.
Destinará el dinero de este préstamo al pago del mantenimiento de sus parcelas, contratará jornaleros para la limpieza y macheteo de la mala hierba de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcial is 54 years old and married to Andelina.  The couple have eight children but now only live with three of them: their 15 year old, 9 year old and 8 year old.  They own their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Santa Teresa (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Marcial has been farming on land that the community gave him for 15 years.  The years have not passed in vain as he works his land with intelligence.  He owns four plots of land where he grows coffee, annatto and bananas.  "Coffee is the most profitable crop because the profits are good once a year.  However, I can cover my daily expenses with the other products", he says.  For this reason, Marcial tends all his crops equally, giving them the same care and devotion.  In this way, he has managed to support his older children and continues doing so for his younger ones.  He is now planning to grow more bananas on a small space he has between his coffee crops.  This will increase his yields.  At the same time, he will work hard to care for his other crops.

This is Marcial's second loan from MFP.  He is grateful for their support and trust, and says that he will make his repayments on time.  He belongs to 'Los Ompicres' community bank.

Marcial will use his loan money to pay to maintain his plots of land.  He will hire laborers to cut and get rid of the weeds among his crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers who will weed his crops

loans.name: San Miguel  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Miguel está formado por 7 socias que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que tienen una geografía accidentada, la misma que nos regala hermosos paisajes de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y también al comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades. Su gente se caracteriza por su amabilidad y cordialidad, son personas de un corazón muy cálido como nuestras socias quienes son trabajadoras y luchan día a día para mejorar la económica de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. María Esther, tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su padre se dedica a la construcción y su madre a la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es  propiedad de sus padres. 

La Señorita. María Esther es costura de profesión, esta actividad la aprendió estudiando y trabajando, ahora tiene un taller pequeño en su casa en donde labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo y se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva. También cría y vende ganado. 

Este en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir  en la compra de hilos y telas.

Su meta es crecer más en su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The San Miguel community bank has seven members who live on the outskirts of el Valle parish, in Cuenca.  This parish has a rugged terrain and beautiful landscapes.  The locals raise animals, farm and work in commerce.  Many work in the city in different activities.  The people are noted for their kindness and friendliness.  They are people with very warm hearts like our members who are hard working and strive every day to improve their households' finances and provide for their families.

One of the members of this group is María Esther.  She is 37 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her parents' house and shares the household expenses.  Her father works in construction and her mother farms.  Her parents own their home.

María Esther is a seamstress by profession.  She learned the trade by studying and working.  She now has a small workshop in her home where she works from Monday to Friday making sports clothing.  She does not work fixed hours.  In addition, she also raises and sells livestock.

This is María Esther's third loan as a member of her community bank and she will invest it in buying threads and fabric.

María Esther's goal is to further grow her dressmaking business.

loans.use: to buy threads and fabric

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 24 años, su pareja es Julio, con quien tiene dos hijos: Harinson y Medaly. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que ambos construyeron y se ubica en el caserío de San Antonio, Tarma.
Desde los 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, con la producción de papas y flores (gladiolos). Como la zona donde vive es muy famosa por los buenos suelos y por ende por los buenos frutos, los propios comercializadores de papa llegan a sus terrenos agrícolas para negociar su cosecha. Por otro lado, las flores son trasladadas hasta el mercado de flores de la ciudad, a donde llegan compradores de distintas ciudades. Julio, su pareja, también es muy trabajador, gracias a los toros que crían pueden arar la tierra con facilidad. Además alquila a estas bestias a otros agricultores a 90 soles a día, obteniendo ingresos adicionales.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso se compromete, una vez más, en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa” y menciona ser una de las socias más puntuales en las reuniones.
Angélica invertirá este dinero en la compra de semillas de papas y 10 bolsas de abono, además de invertir en la preparación de sus tierras para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Angélica is 24 years old.  Her partner is Julio and the couple have two children: Harinson and Medaly.  They live together in their own home, which they both built, in the small village of San Antonio, Tarma.

Angélica has been farming for 20 years, growing potatoes and flowers (gladioli).  As the area in which she lives is very well known for its good soil and, therefore, its good crops, potato sellers come to her to negotiate for her harvests.  The flowers, meanwhile, are transported to the flower market in the city where buyers come from different towns.  Julio, her partner, is also very hard working.  Thanks to the bulls that they raise, they are able to plow their land easily.  In addition, they hire these animals out to other farmers for 90 soles a day which makes them additional income.

This is Angélica's fifth loan from MFP and she pledges, once again, to make her monthly repayments on time.  She belongs to the 'Santa Rosa' community bank and says that she is one of the most punctual members in their meetings.

Angélica will invest this money in buying potato seeds and ten bags of fertilizer.  She will also invest in preparing her land for her upcoming planting season.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años, está casado con Dominga, tienen seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con tres de ellos.
Toda su vida estuvo rodeado de personas que se dedicaban al campo, por eso se desempeña en esta actividades con destreza. Los suelos de su distrito son propicios para la siembra de papa de distintas variedades, arvejas, habas y algunas hortalizas. Y él aprovecha muy bien este beneficio cultivando todo lo que sea rentable. Él y su esposa trabajan la tierra, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos, así mantuvieron y educaron a sus hijos que ahora ya tienen familia. El trabajo en el campo es intenso, por eso con frecuencia contratan a peones a quienes pagan al día 30 soles. A pedro le gusta el trabajo del campo, porque además de cultivar sus productos puede pastar a sus animales en libertad. Este mes es adecuado para la siembra de papa, por eso tiene planeado cultivar dos “tongos” (parcelas de terrenos) para este año.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y agradece la confianza por tanto tiempo de trabajo. Su banco comunal se llama “Santa Rosa”, cuyos socios comparten con él los mismos intereses de crecimiento.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de papa de la variedad “Única”, con la que iniciará su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old.  He is married to Dominga and they have six children.  They currently live with three of them.

Pedro has been surrounded by people who work on the land his entire life.  For that reason, he does his work with skill.  The soil in his district is ideal for growing different varieties of potatoes, peas, broad beans and some vegetables.  He makes the most of this benefit, growing everything that is profitable.  He and his wife work the land and this is their main source of income.  It is how they have supported and educated their children who now have their own families.  Farm work is intense and so they often hire laborers who they pay 30 soles a day.  Pedro likes farm work because, in addition to growing his crops, he is able to pasture his animals freely.  This month is suitable for sowing potatoes and so he plans to grow two 'tongos' (plots of land) this year.

This is Pedro's seventh loan from MFP and he is grateful for the trust that is placed in him.  His community bank is called 'Santa Rosa' and the members share the same interest in growing their businesses as he does.

Pedro will invest the money from this loan in buying Única potatoes for his upcoming planting.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Solema

texts.es:
Solema tiene 44 años, está casada hace más de 20 años, tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cinco de ellos. Su casa es de material rústico, pero cálida, se ubica en el anexo de San Antonio, Tarma.
Sus terrenos de cultivos son su prioridad, ya que se dedica a la agricultura. Gracias a muchos años de arduo trabajo consiguió comprar sus propias parcelas. Por las mañanas, después de preparar los alimentos, se dirige hacia sus cultivos para atenderlos. La mayor parte del tiempo se encarga de acomodar la tierra y regarla. No siempre hay lluvias, por eso ella y los comuneros se distribuyen horarios para disponer del agua. Sus principales productos son papa, arveja, maíz, habas y zanahoria, productos que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, para ello debe viajar como una hora. Pero todo su esfuerzo se ve recompensado cuando obtiene buenas ventas. Ella es una mujer visionaria, por eso cada año se sigue esforzando en mejorar su producción.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP. Es una cliente responsable con sus pagos, además es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal “Santa Rosa”.
Solema invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bolsas de semillas de arvejas y papa. Con lo restante adquirirá bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Solema is 44 years old.  She has been married for more than 20 years and has six children.  She currently lives with five of them.  Her house is made out of rustic materials but it is warm.  It is located in San Antonio, Tarma.

Solema's farm land is her priority as her business is farming.  She heads out to her crops to tend to them.  She spends most of her time getting the land ready and irrigating it.  The rain doesn't always come and so she and her fellow community members share time slots for the water.  The main crops she grows are potatoes, peas, broad beans, corn and carrots.  She sells these products in the wholesale market in the city.  In order to do this she has to travel for one hour.  However, all her hard work is rewarded when she makes good sales.  Solema is a visionary woman and so every year she continues working hard to improve her yields.

This is Solema's ninth loan from MFP.  She is responsible in making her repayments and is one of the founding members of the 'Santa Rosa' community bank.

Solema will invest the money she has requested in buying bags of pea and potato seeds.  She will use the rest to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pea and potato seeds, and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 29 years old, married, and a loving mother of three young kids. She earns a livelihood by raising pigs and poultry in her yard while her husband is involved in a fishing business. San and her husband agreed to send all her children to school, however hard that means they have to work in their daily lives. 

San has applied for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to build a strong ladder up into her house because the old one is not safe for the family to use any longer. This will help San and her family have a comfortable living conditions. She is very thankful and is confident she will pay her loan back punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a strong ladder up into her house.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 41 años, está casada con Alberto, viven con cinco de los seis que tienen. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el anexo agrícola de San Antonio.
La agricultura ha sido y será la actividad que los sustenta, la que aprendió de sus padres y la que enseña a sus hijos, quienes a su corta edad cooperan en labores del campo. Además tiene cuatro vacas, las que cría para luego venderlas como ganado o carne. Su última cosecha le dio 30 sacos de papas, las que vendió satisfactoriamente. “Si hay suerte se obtiene buen dinero, pero hay ocasiones en que los gusanos y las heladas malogras los cultivos”, menciona como principal problema. Agrega que, por falta de capital muchas veces sembró un poco, pues la inversión abarca semillas, abonos y mano de obra de terceros. Alejandrina se ve en el futuro sembrando en más parcelas y comprando más animales. Piensa que si no dejará a sus hijos mucho dinero como herencia, por lo menos les designará animales y terrenos para su cultivo.

Esta es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, cree que poco a poco logrará sus objetivos si siguen con la misma actitud.
Alejandrina destinará este préstamo en la compra de sacos de abono para las varias parcelas de terreno agrícola que posee, tanto para sus sembríos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 41 years old and married to Alberto.  They live with five of their six children.  They own their own home which is located in San Antonio.

Farming has been and will continue to be the business that supports her family.  She learned it from her parents and teaches it to her children who, at their young age, help out with the farm work.  Alejandrina also has four cows which she raises and then sells either as cattle or as meat.  Her latest harvest provided her with 30 sacks of potatoes which she sold satisfactorily.  "If you are lucky, you make good money.  However, on some occasions worms or frosts ruin the crops", Alejandrina mentions as her main problem.  She adds that, owing to a lack of capital, she often used to sow just a little as the investment needed includes seeds, fertilizer and labor.  In the future, Alejandrina sees herself sowing her crops over additional plots of land and buying more animals.  She believes that even if she doesn't leave her children much money for their inheritance, at least she will be able to give them animals and land to grow crops on.

This is Alejandrina's eight loan from MFP.  She believes that she will gradually achieve her aims if she continues in this business.

Alejandrina will use this loan to buy bags of fertilizer for the several plots of farmland that she owns.  She will use it on her potatoes and her peas.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for her potatoes and peas

loans.name: Phim

texts.en:
Phim, aged 51, is a single mother who has given birth to four children. One of them is married and lives elsewhere while the others live with her in a house in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Being a responsible mother, Phim works very hard raising poultry and selling fish in order to provide basic necessities to her children. Phim’s son is a main fish supplier who goes fishing along the Tonle Sap River every day. Also, Phim buys fresh fish from local people and then she takes them to the marketplace. From this business, Phim can earn in the neighborhood of KHR 16,700 each day. Phim is happy because all of her children are very helpful in her family-owned businesses.

To sustain her selling business and maintain the financial stability of the family, Phim decided to obtain a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to purchase a new boat with an engine for her son's fishing activities. She hopes that her business will improve through the help of the loan from kind lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat with an engine for fishing activities.

loans.name: Saruon

texts.en:
Aged 50, Saruon has nine dependent children. She lives in the rural village of Ek Phnom district of Battambang, Cambodia. To support the big family, she has been farming on two-hectares of rice field for ten years. She is able to earn about KHR 42,200 from her current business. The main challenge she faces is having her crops destroyed by floods.

Saruon has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have given her family a better standard of living. Now she is applying for a new loan of KHR 3,000,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay the fees for plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the crop yield so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay the fee for plowing.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Ratanak Mondul of Battambang province of Cambodia, Ren is a 48 years old mother of eight children. Six of the eight are still under her care and help the family’s business. To earn a living, Ren has been planting rice on two-hectares of farmland as the primary income. Additionally, she grows beans and corns. From her current businesses, Ret earns about KHR 30,000 per day. The main challenge for her is the lack of water which reduces crop yields.  

This is Ren’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 and is planning to use this loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay to plow her farmland. She hopes to earn more profit for her family’s sake and to expand her current businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds and pay to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Ny is 42-year-old mother of three children, two (one daughter and one son) of whom are staying with her. To earn a living, Ny has been farming rice on 2-hectare of farmland for 20 years. She supplements her family’s income by selling ice-cream. She can earn approximately KHR 62,800 per day from her current businesses. The main challenge of her business is the drought which affects her crop yield.

Ny’s group consists of two female members who received a loan from VisionFund for one cycle already. The first loan has helped her to stabilize her ice-cream business and make a better living. Now she is requesting a new loan of KHR 300,000. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. In the future, she plans to generate income by expanding her businesses to make a comfortable living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 44 años, su pareja es Sonia, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Ellos viven juntos en la casa que Emilio construyó con mucho esfuerzo y se ubica en el anexo de tierras fértiles y clima frío de San Antonio.
Hace 26 años que él se dedica a la agricultura. Con el apoyo de su esposa ha logrado cubrir todo el trabajo cansado que significa cuidar los cultivos, podarlos y cosecharlos. Siembra papas, arvejas, habas y cebada. La recompensa que obtiene del campo son buenas cuando los precios son favorables, pero hay días en que el clima no le favorece, por ejemplo, por ubicarse a una altitud considerable, las heladas atacan sus cultivos. Hubo un año en que llegó a perder toda una cosecha. Entre sus metas próximas está mejorar su producción de papas para este año, ya que los pronósticos dicen que los precios serán mejores que el año pasado. Pero Emilio se considera un especialista en el cultivo de arvejas, así que no descuidará una próxima siembra de este producto.

Este es su préstamo número 9 con MFP. Reafirma su fidelidad hacia la entidad por la oportunidad de desarrollo que le brinda, además de las charlas educativas que recibe con frecuencia.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas (con 1200 soles), lo restante será para bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Emilio is 44 years old.  His partner is Sonia and the couple have five children.  They live together in a house that Emilio worked hard to build.  It is located in San Antonio, a community with fertile land and a cold climate.

Emilio has been farming for 26 years.  With the support of his wife, he has managed to carry out all the tiring work involved in tending, pruning and harvesting their crops.  He sows potatoes, peas, broad beans and barley.  The rewards he obtains from the farm work are good when prices are favorable.  However, there are times when the weather is not favorable.  As he lives at high altitude, frosts attack his crops.  One year he lost an entire harvest.  Emilio's immediate goal is to improve his potato yields this year because forecasts suggest that prices will be better than they were last year.  However, Emilio considers himself to be a specialist in growing peas and so he will be sure to look after this crop too. 

This is Emilio's ninth loan from MFP.  He re-affirms his loyalty to the entity because of the opportunity they have given him to develop his business.  He is also grateful for the educational talks that he frequently receives.

Emilio will invest this money in buying two bags of pea seeds (1,200 soles).  He will use the rest to buy bags of fertilizer for his potatoes and peas.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon is 52 years old, and a married mother of five children living in the rural area of Thmor Koul district of Battambang, Cambodia. She has farmed rice on ten-hectares of land for almost twenty years and supplements her family income by fishing. From her current business, she is able is earn about KHR 34,000 to meet the family’s need. 

Samon’s group consists of two members who are females. She is in her sixth cycle while her co-member is in her fifth cycle with VisionFund. Samon successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to save money to buy pigs and chickens to raise for additional income.  Now, she and her co-member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to improve the family’s living conditions and give them a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
This borrower is called Muth and she is a resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Muth started working in a farming business when she was a teenager living with her parents. She is now 35 years old and is married to Soun, her spouse as well as her business partner, and a father of two school-aged children. In coming raining season, Muth and her husband have many tasks to be done in the field. They start work from the early morning and finish their work schedule around 5pm. Her children help cook and serve food to their parents at lunch time.

Muth wants to own a suitable house which provides comfortable living conditions for her family. Thus, she is asking for a loan to add to her capital to purchase additional timers and wooden boards. After Muth completes her farm work, she will hire six laborers to start renovating her old house with the construction supplies she has purchased. In the future, Muth would like to purchase a few lots of farm land, cows, and needed farm supplies to expand her business and increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase additional timers and wooden boards for renovating her old house.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a 29-year-old married woman living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been involved in a fishing business for several years now. Fishing is a booming business in their locality, and that's the main reason why Hazel and her husband invested in the business. 

Hazel is asking for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy additional fishing materials such as fishing nets, a flashlight, a basin and others. This equipment is essential to enhance the amount her husband catches when he goes fishing. Hazel works hard to support her family and three young children aged eight, four and a baby of a few months. 
 
In the future, Hazel hopes to expand her business so that they will be able to earn more thus having a greater chance of sending her children to school and experiencing the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials such as fishing nets, a flashlight and a basin.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Phea, 47, is living the rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She is a widow with five dependent daughters, one of whom is still in school. To overcome the family’s hardship especially in raising her children alone, she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 30 years, and she is able to earn approximately KHR 17,000 per day. From this income, she manages to save about KHR 7,000 per day. 

This is Phea’s group first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The group consists of three members and Phea is the group leader. She is requesting a loan of KHR 200,000 from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her portion to build a proper toilet for the family to use. She hopes to have a clean toilet for the family’s hygiene purposes.

loans.use: To build a proper toilet.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia tiene 54 años. Vive con su esposo Julio y con dos de sus siete hijos; en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Pucharini (selva central). 
Ella es una mujer que no se cansa fácilmente, a su edad aún continúa dedicándose a la actividad que le permitió mantener a su familia durante todo este tiempo, la agricultura. Son más de 20 años que lleva cogiendo las herramientas de trabajo y dirigiéndose hacia sus parcelas. La comunidad le otorgó cuatro cuadras de terrenos donde produce café y frutas como plátanos y naranjas. Con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor, de 19 años, puede mantener productivos sus cultivos. “Lo que nos absorbe más es la limpieza del café, todos los días tenemos que sacar la mala hierba”, menciona. También cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde vende productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, arroz, golosinas, fideos, etc. Así obtiene un ingreso extra para su familia.

Este es el crédito número 9 que recibe de MFP y agradece la confianza, comenta que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas. Por otro lado, Octavia es una socia muy activa dentro del banco comunal “Sankori” porque, según cuenta, es la única mujer.
Con este dinero iniciará la poda de las plantas de café. Pagará 30 soles diarios a los peones que contratará para esta actividad.
texts.en:
Octavia is 54 years old.  She lives with her husband Julio and two of their seven children.  They live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Pucharini (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Octavia is a woman who does not tire easily.  At her age, she still continues working in the business which has allowed her to support her family during all this time: farming.  She has been picking up her work tools and heading off to her plots of farmland for more than 20 years.  The community gave her four 'cuadras' (just over 7 acres) of land where she grows coffee and fruit such as bananas and oranges.  With the help of her husband and 19-year-old son, she is able to keep their crops productive.  "What takes up most of our time and energy is weeding the coffee.  Every day we have to weed", she says.  Octavia also has a small grocery store where she sells staple goods such as sugar, rice, candies, noodles, etc.  This makes her extra income for her family.

This is Octavia's ninth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the trust that is placed in her.  She says that she will make her repayments punctually.  Octavia is a very active member within her community bank 'Sankori' because, she says, she is the only woman.

Octavia will use this money to start pruning her coffee plants.  She will pay the laborers she hires to do this work 30 soles.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who will prune her coffee plants

loans.name: Philma

texts.en:
Philma is 56 years old, married, and has seven children. 

Philma has an agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Philma requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Philma has been pig-fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Philma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Faile

texts.es:
Faile tiene 53 años. Hace 10 años que se separó de la madre de sus hijos, tiene cuatro, quienes ya dejaron el hogar. Él vive solo en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Pucharini (selva central).
Desde los 18 años se dedica a la agricultura. Su trabajo es arduo, empezando por la limpieza de la mala hierba para iniciar cualquier plantación. Actualmente produce café, plátanos, maíz, yuca y kión. Cuenta con siete parcelas de terrenos donde cultiva estos productos. En todos sus años como hombre del campo ha recibido muchas satisfacciones, como también ciertos fracasos. Recuerda que hace 12 años, toda su producción de maíz y kión se perdieron por causa de una plaga. Esa experiencia le ha enseñado a tomar provisiones y estar preparado para la falta de lluvias o de los insectos. Desde entonces sus cosechas le dan mejores resultados. Ahora piensa volver a sembrar más maíz y plátanos para ello requiere varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos y semillas.

Este es el crédito número 11 que recibe de MFP. Está muy agradecido por todo el apoyo brindado en todos estos años. Pertenece al banco comunal “Sankori”, del que se siente contento por el trabajo coordinado con sus socios.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz, mamones de plátanos y bolsas de fertilizantes, para iniciar una siembra.
texts.en:
Faile is 53 years old.  He separated from the mother of his children ten years ago.  He has four children who have already left home.  Faile lives alone in his own home which is located in the indigenous community of Pucharini (central Peruvian jungle).

Faile has been farming since he was 18.  His work is hard.  He starts by getting rid of weeds in order to begin any planting work.  He currently grows coffee, bananas, corn, cassava and ginger.  He has seven plots of land where he grows these crops.  Over the years he has been farming, he has had a lot of satisfaction as well as some failures.  He remembers that, twelve years ago, he lost all his corn and ginger crop because of pests.  This experience taught him to take precautions and be prepared for a lack of rain, or insects.  Since then, his harvests have given him better results.  He now plans to start sowing more corn and bananas and he needs several bags of organic fertilizer and seeds to do this.

This is Faile's eleventh loan from MFP.  He is very grateful for all the support he has received over the years.  He is a member of the 'Sankori' community bank and he feels happy with his group because of the coordinated work of its members.

Faile will invest the money from this loan in buying corn seeds, banana plants and bags of fertilizer so that he can start his planting.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, banana plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Angelita Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Angelita es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, este lugar es de clima frió, se encuentra a 18 km., de la ciudad de Cuenca, desde el centro de esta parroquia se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su principal economía es la agricultura, cría de animales y al comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

Doña Angelita tiene 64 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, tres hijas son solteras, trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Angelita pasa el mayor de su tiempo al cuidado de su hogar y para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, también tiene vacas lecheras y la leche que obtiene de su ganado lo convierte en quesillo para la venta. 

Pertenece al banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Angelita belongs to "Unión Progresista" communal bank.
She lives in a community belonging to the parish of Santa Ana; The community's weather is cold, It is located 18km from the city of Cuenca. From the centre of this parish one can see a big part of the city of Cuenca. Their main economic activities are agriculture, animal breeding and commerce, many people works in the city on different economic activities.

Angelita is 64, she is married and in her married life she has conceived 6 children, three of them are married and are living independently, three daughters are single and help economically to the support of the family. Her husband works as a day laborer. They live in their own house.

Angelita spends most of her time taking care of her home and to contribute to the economy of her homestead she works in the business of husbandry and breeding of pigs, she also has milking cows and the milk she obtains from her cattle she makes in to cheese for selling.

She's been a member of the communal bank for 7 years and she is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of a cow.

Her goal is to keep growing in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 37 años, su pareja es Erlinda, con quien tiene tres hijos de 12 y 7 años y un pequeño bebé de un mes. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Pucharini (selva central).
Walter se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y tubérculos como: naranjas, mandarinas, piñas, paltas, papaya, yuca, kión y otros que el suelo de su zona produce. Lleva como 5 años en este negocio y le va bien. “Viajo dos veces a la semana hacia Lima (capital del Perú), llevando mi mercadería y la vendo rápido en el mercado mayorista”, menciona. Al inicio tenía problemas para juntar sus productos, pero con el tiempo consiguió proveedores que le otorgaban la mercadería en fechas fijas. De esa manera su negocio marcha bien. Además también obtiene ingresos de sus propias cosechas, ya que se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando café y plátanos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. “Sankori” es el nombre de su banco comunal del que muestra identificación.
Con este dinero podrá adquirir cajones de frutas y tubérculos de distintas variedades (naranjas, piñas, paltas, papayas, yucas, etc), las que llevará hacia la ciudad de Lima para negociarlas.
texts.en:
Walter is 37 years old.  His partner is Erlinda and the couple have three children: a 12 year old, a 7 year old and a one-month-old baby.  They live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Pucharini (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Walter buys and sells fruit and tubers such as oranges, mandarins, pineapples, avocados, cassava, ginger, and others that grow in the soil in his area.  He has been in this business for 5 years and it is going well.  "I travel to Lima (the capital of Peru) twice a week with my merchandise and I sell it quickly in the wholesale market", he says.  At first he had problems getting his products together.  However, over time he managed to gain suppliers who gave him the merchandise on fixed dates.  In this way, his business has done well.  In addition, he also makes income from his own harvests as he is also a farmer and grows coffee and bananas.

This is Walter's second loan from MFP and he pledges to make his monthly repayments on time.  His community bank is called 'Sankori'.

Walter will use this money to acquire crates of fruit and tubers of different types (oranges, pineapples, avocados, papayas, cassava, etc.)  He will take them to Lima to negotiate their sale.

loans.use: to buy crates of fruit and tubers to take to Lima to sell

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, este lugar es de clima frió, se encuentra a 18 km., de la ciudad de Cuenca, desde el centro de esta parroquia se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su principal economía es la agricultura, cría de animales y al comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora Rosa tiene 54 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, cinco de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero tiene una discapacidad física por lo que pasa en casa, también cuida de un nieto desde muy tierno y ahora se encuentra estudiando en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa pasa en casa al cuidado de su hogar, alli cría  y vende gallinas y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura y sus cultivos son para el consumo de su casa y  si hay sobrante lo vende.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cerdos y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es  seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to "Unión Progresista" communal bank.
She lives in a community belonging to the parish of Santa Ana; The community's weather is cold, It is located 18km from the city of Cuenca. From the centre of this parish one can see a big part of the city of Cuenca. Their main economic activities are agriculture, animal breeding and commerce, many people work in the city in different economic activities.

Rosa is 54, she is married and in her married life she has conceived 6 children, five of them are married and are living independently, her single child has a physical disability which is why he lives at home, she also takes care of a grandson since he was very young, he now goes to a school in the community Her husband works in agriculture. They live in their own house.

Rosa spends most of her time taking care of her home, there she breeds chickens and guinea pigs, she also works in agriculture and what she reaps is for her homestead's consumption if there is any left she sells it.

She's been a member of the communal bank for 12 years and is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens, pigs and food for her animals.

Her goal is to keep growing in animal breeding.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and animal food.

loans.name: Albertino

texts.es:
Albertino tiene 29 años. Vive solo en la casa de uno de sus familiares, se ubica en la comunidad nativa Pucharini (selva central).
Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la agricultura de forma independiente, antes lo hacía para ayudar a su familia. Administra tres parcelas de terrenos que arrienda de otros pobladores, en ellas produce plátanos y maíz. En todos estos años se dio cuenta que sus ventas son más efectivas si las traslada hacia la ciudad que se ubica a media hora de su vivienda. Este año el precio del plátano le favorece, ya que cada kilo lo ofrece a 1 sol con 20 céntimos. Teniendo en cuenta que cada quince días recoge alrededor de 1000 kilos, sus ganancias son buenas. Pero además tiene que destinar una buena cantidad para los trabajos de limpieza y esparcimiento de abono, para ello contrata personal, a quienes paga por cada día. Albertino es un hombre ambicioso, ahora quiere arrendar más terrenos y así ampliar su producción.

Este es el primer crédito que recibe de MFP. Menciona que será puntual en los pagos y participativo dentro de su banco comunal “Sankori”.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de mamones de plátano, cuyo precio es de 40 céntimos por cada uno. Además adquirirá semillas de maíz.
texts.en:
Albertino is 29 years old.  He lives alone in a house belonging to a family member, in the indigenous community of Pucharini (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Albertino has been farming independently for seven years.  Before this he used to farm to help his family.  He has three plots of land which he rents from other residents on which he grows bananas and corn.  Over the years he has come to realize that his sales are more effective if he transports his crops to the town which is half an hour from his home.  This year banana prices are favorable as they are selling for 1 sol, 20 cents a kilo.  Bearing in mind he harvests around 1,000 kilos every two weeks, his profits are good.  However, he also has to spend a large amount of money on weeding and fertilizing work, as he has to hire laborers who he pays each day.  Albertino is an ambitious man.  He would like to rent more land and thereby increase his production.

This is Albertino's first loan from MFP.  He says that he will be punctual in making his repayments and will be active within his community bank (Sankori).

Albertino will invest this money in buying banana plants which cost 40 cents each.  He will also buy corn seeds.

loans.use: to buy banana plants and corn seed

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 64 años, es viudo. Tiene un hijo, pero que ya dejó el hogar. Él vive solo en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Pucharini (selva central).
Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, y con todos sus años de experiencia ha descubierto nuevas técnicas de mejorar sus ventas y productos. Hace 40 años que se dedica a las labores del campo con el cultivo de café, palta, plátano. Le fue muy bien con las cosechas de café, pero menciona que requiere de mucho trabajo, y como él ya es un hombre mayor, ahora le da mayor prioridad al plátano y la palta. Hace 7 meses incursionó en un producto nuevo y rentable, el “Sachainchi”, es una planta trepadora de cuyas semillas se obtiene un aceite muy solicitado por su alto porcentaje vitamínico. “Hace 2 años nos vinieron a capacitar y desde entonces tenemos en la comunidad una planta procesadora de aceite”, menciona. Ahora se encarga de vender aceite y el mismo maneja la máquina. Una de sus metas es consolidar la asociación de comuneros para buscar mercados en el extranjero. Eusebio es un hombre visionario.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Da su palabra de pagar con responsabilidad las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de ingresar como socio al banco comunal “Sankori” y se muestra interesado con las actividades.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá adquirir madera y alambres para adecuar sus cultivos de sachainchi, ya que son plantas trepadoras.
texts.en: Eusebio is 64 years old and a widower. He has one child who has already left home. He lives alone in his own home which is located in the indigenous community of Pucharini (in the central Peruvian jungle). Eusebio's main business activity is farming and, with all his years of experience, he has discovered new techniques for improving his sales and crops. He has been farming for 40 years, growing coffee, avocados and bananas. His coffee harvests are very good but he says that they require a lot of work and, as he is an elderly man, he now gives most priority to his bananas and avocados. Seven months ago, he started growing a new and profitable crop: sacha inchi. This is a climbing plant from whose seeds an oil can be extracted. This oil is very much in demand because of its high percentage of vitamins. "Two years ago they came to train us and now we have an oil processing plant in our community", he says. Eusebio is in charge of selling oil and he runs the machine himself. One of his goals is to strengthen the farmers' association in order to find markets abroad. Eusebio is a visionary man. This is Eusebio's first loan from MFP. He gives his word that he will make his monthly repayments on time. He has just joined the Sankori community bank and he is very interested in their activities.
